The novel "The Small House at Allington" revolves around the lives of the Dale family, who reside in the Small House, a property intended for the widowed mother of the estate's owner. The landowner, Christopher Dale, has allocated the Small House to his sister-in-law and her daughters, Isabella and Lilian, rent-free. Lilian has secretly harbored feelings for John Eames, a junior clerk at the Income Tax Office, while Isabella is in love with the local doctor, James Crofts.

The arrival of Adolphus Crosbie, a charming but somewhat self-serving individual, shakes up the dynamics of the group. Introduced by Christopher's nephew, Bernard Dale, Crosbie proposes marriage to Lilian, who accepts, much to the dismay of John Eames. However, Crosbie soon abandons Lilian for Lady Alexandrina de Courcy, whose family connections hold the key to his career advancement.

Liliana's heartbreak is met with patience, and she continues to reject Eames' affections, while maintaining their close friendship. Isabella, on the other hand, marries Dr. Crofts after turning down an offer from her cousin Bernard. Like many of Anthony Trollope's novels, "The Small House at Allington" is filled with intricate subplots and a cast of supporting characters.

The novel also marks the first appearance of Plantagenet Palliser, a character from the "Pallisers" series, who is contemplating a romantic entanglement with Griselda Grantly, now Lady Dumbello, the daughter of the Archdeacon from the Chronicles of Barsetshire.

Rewritten:
The Small House at Allington concerns the Dale family, who live in the "Small House", a dower house intended for the widowed mother (Dowager) of the owner of the estate. The landowner, in this instance, is the bachelor Squire of Allington, Christopher Dale. Dale's mother having died, he has allocated the Small House, rent free, to his widowed sister-in-law and her daughters Isabella ("Bell") and Lilian ("Lily"). Lily has for a long time been secretly loved by John Eames, a junior clerk at the Income Tax Office, while Bell is in love with the local doctor, James Crofts. 

The handsome and personable, somewhat mercenary Adolphus Crosbie is introduced into the circle by the squire's nephew, Bernard Dale. 

Adolphus rashly proposes marriage to portionless Lily, who accepts him, to the dismay of John Eames. 

Crosbie soon jilts her in favour of Lady Alexandrina de Courcy, whose family is in a position to further his career. 

Lily meets her misfortune with patience, and remains single, continuing to reject Eames, though retaining his faithful friendship. Bell marries Dr Crofts, after refusing an offer of marriage from her cousin Bernard. As with all of Trollope's novels, this one contains many sub-plots and numerous minor characters. 

Plantagenet Palliser (of the "Pallisers" series) makes his first appearance, as he contemplates a dalliance with Griselda Grantly, the now-married Lady Dumbello, daughter of the Archdeacon introduced earlier in the Chronicles of Barsetshire.

1 cup milk  
5 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided  
1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour  
1/4 teaspoon salt  
1 dash ground nutmeg  
1 dash freshly ground black pepper  
1 teaspoon sherry wine vinegar  
1/3 cup fresh breadcrumbs  
1 lb diver scallops (about 12)  
1/3 cup Gruyère cheese, grated  

Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until it simmers. While the milk is warming, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring, until it becomes foamy, about 3 minutes. Pour in the hot milk all at once while whisking continuously. Stir the sauce until it thickens and bubbles. Remove from heat and mix in the salt, nutmeg, black pepper, and sherry vinegar. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary. Allow to cool slightly before proceeding.  

Heat a medium skillet over medium heat and melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the breadcrumbs to coat them evenly with the butter. Set aside. Preheat the broiler and position an oven rack to the highest setting. Place the shells (or ramekins) on a baking sheet. Arrange 2 scallops in each shell. Top each scallop with about 3 tablespoons of the sauce. Sprinkle some of the cheese over the sauce and finish with a tablespoon or so of the buttered breadcrumbs. Broil the scallops for about 7 minutes. The sauce and cheese should be golden brown. The scallops should be tender and juicy, not overcooked. Carefully transfer the hot scallops in their shells (or ramekins) to a serving plate. Serve immediately.

​m​e​l​t​ ​3​ ​t​a​b​l​e​s​p​o​o​n​s​ ​o​f​ ​t​h​e​ ​b​u​t​t​e​r​ ​i​n​ ​a​ ​m​e​d​i​u​m​ ​s​a​u​c​e​p​a​n​ ​o​v​e​r​ ​m​e​d​i​u​m​ ​h​e​a​t​.​ ​A​d​d​ ​t​h​e​ ​f​l​o​u​r​ ​a​n​d​ ​c​o​o​k​,​ ​s​t​i​r​r​i​n​g​,​ ​u​n​t​i​l​ ​f​o​a​m​y​,​ ​a​b​o​u​t​ ​3​ ​m​i​n​u​t​e​s​.​ ​A​d​d​ ​t​h​e​ ​h​o​t​ ​m​i​l​k​ ​a​l​l​ ​a​t​ ​o​n​c​e​ ​w​h​i​l​e​ ​w​h​i​s​k​i​n​g​.​ ​S​t​i​r​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​u​c​e​ ​u​n​t​i​l​ ​i​t​ ​i​s​ ​t​h​i​c​k​ ​a​n​d​ ​b​u​b​b​l​y​.​ ​R​e​m​o​v​e​ ​f​r​o​m​ ​t​h​e​ ​h​e​a​t​ ​a​n​d​ ​a​d​d​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​l​t​,​ ​n​u​t​m​e​g​,​ ​b​l​a​c​k​ ​p​e​p​p​e​r​,​ ​a​n​d​ ​s​h​e​r​r​y​ ​v​i​n​e​g​a​r​.​ ​T​a​s​t​e​ ​f​o​r​ ​s​e​a​s​o​n​i​n​g​ ​a​n​d​ ​a​d​j​u​s​t​ ​i​f​ ​n​e​c​e​s​s​a​r​y​.​ ​L​e​t​ ​c​o​o​l​ ​s​l​i​g​h​t​l​y​ ​b​e​f​o​r​e​ ​c​o​n​t​i​n​u​i​n​g​.​ ​H​e​a​t​ ​a​ ​m​e​d​i​u​m​ ​s​k​i​l​l​e​t​ ​o​v​e​r​ ​m​e​d​i​u​m​ ​h​e​a​t​ ​a​n​d​ ​m​e​l​t​ ​t​h​e​ ​r​e​m​a​i​n​i​n​g​ ​2​ ​t​a​b​l​e​s​p​o​o​n​s​ ​o​f​ ​b​u​t​t​e​r​.​ ​R​e​m​o​v​e​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​k​i​l​l​e​t​ ​f​r​o​m​ ​t​h​e​ ​h​e​a​t​ ​a​n​d​ ​s​t​i​r​ ​i​n​ ​t​h​e​ ​b​r​e​a​d​c​r​u​m​b​s​ ​t​o​ ​c​o​a​t​ ​t​h​e​m​ ​e​v​e​n​l​y​ ​w​i​t​h​ ​t​h​e​ ​b​u​t​t​e​r​.​ ​R​e​s​e​r​v​e​.​ ​P​r​e​h​e​a​t​ ​t​h​e​ ​b​r​o​i​l​e​r​ ​a​n​d​ ​a​r​r​a​n​g​e​ ​a​n​ ​o​v​e​n​ ​r​a​c​k​ ​t​o​ ​t​h​e​ ​h​i​g​h​e​s​t​ ​p​o​s​i​t​i​o​n​.​ ​S​e​t​ ​o​u​t​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​h​e​l​l​s​ ​(​o​r​ ​r​a​m​e​k​i​n​s​)​ ​o​n​ ​a​ ​b​a​k​i​n​g​ ​s​h​e​e​t​.​ ​A​r​r​a​n​g​e​ ​2​ ​s​c​a​l​l​o​p​s​ ​i​n​ ​e​a​c​h​.​ ​T​o​p​ ​e​a​c​h​ ​s​c​a​l​l​o​p​ ​w​i​t​h​ ​a​b​o​u​t​ ​3​ ​t​a​b​l​e​s​p​o​o​n​s​ ​o​f​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​u​c​e​.​ ​S​p​r​i​n​k​l​e​ ​s​o​m​e​ ​o​f​ ​t​h​e​ ​c​h​e​e​s​e​ ​o​v​e​r​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​u​c​e​ ​a​n​d​ ​t​o​p​ ​w​i​t​h​ ​a​ ​t​a​b​l​e​s​p​o​o​n​ ​o​r​ ​s​o​ ​o​f​ ​t​h​e​ ​b​u​t​t​e​r​e​d​ ​b​r​e​a​d​c​r​u​m​b​s​.​ ​B​r​o​i​l​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​c​a​l​l​o​p​s​ ​f​o​r​ ​a​b​o​u​t​ ​7​ ​m​i​n​u​t​e​s​.​ ​T​h​e​ ​s​a​u​c​e​ ​a​n​d​ ​c​h​e​e​s​e​ ​s​h​o​u​l​d​ ​b​e​ ​g​o​l​d​e​n​ ​b​r​o​w​n​.​ ​T​h​e​ ​s​c​a​l​l​o​p​s​ ​s​h​o​u​l​d​ ​b​e​ ​t​e​n​d​e​r​ ​a​n​d​ ​j​u​i​c​y​,​ ​n​o​t​ ​o​v​e​r​c​o​o​k​e​d​.​ ​C​a​r​e​f​u​l​l​y​ ​t​r​a​n​s​f​e​r​ ​t​h​e​ ​h​o​t​ ​s​c​a​l​l​o​p​s​ ​i​n​ ​t​h​e​i​r​ ​s​h​e​l​l​s​ ​(​o​r​ ​r​a​m​e​k​i​n​s​)​ ​t​o​ ​a​ ​s​e​r​v​i​n​g​ ​p​l​a​t​e​.​ ​S​e​r​v​e​ ​i​m​m​e​d​i​a​t​e​l​y​.​

She allowed him to weep, remaining quiet and softly stroking his back, understanding that it was difficult for him to accept their reality, that his old self was gone, and that she would soon follow.

Rewritten:
She let him cry, sitting silently and just rubbing his back gently, knowing it was hard to come to terms with their situation, that his former self was dead, and soon she would be too.

I am writing to inform you that I have stepped down as Enron's Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer, effective immediately. This decision was made in collaboration with Enron's Board and the Creditor Committee, who have agreed that it is in the best interest of the company to move forward with a new leader.

As Enron navigates its path out of bankruptcy, it requires a CEO who can devote their full attention to rebuilding the company. Unfortunately, with the numerous investigations and inquiries that I am currently facing, I am unable to give Enron the focus it needs at this time. My priority should be preserving value for our creditors and employees, but I am unable to do so with the current demands on my time.

The Creditor Committee has begun the process of finding a restructuring specialist to serve as interim CEO, who will work alongside Enron's remaining management team to oversee the company's ongoing operations. I am confident that Enron will emerge from this challenging period and continue to thrive.

During my time at Enron, I have witnessed incredible growth and transformation. I have seen our team build a world-class gas pipeline network, open up new energy markets, and develop innovative solutions like EnronOnline. I am proud of the progress we have made and the dedication of our employees.

I want to express my gratitude to each of you for your contributions to Enron and for the inspiration you have been to me over the years. I will remain a Director of the Board to ensure a smooth transition and to help guide the company through this difficult period.

Sincerely,
Ken Lay

Rewritten:
Subject: Message from Ken Lay

Body: Earlier today, I stepped down as Enron's Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer.
This decision was reached in cooperation with Enron's Board and the Creditor Committee and is effective immediately.
To emerge from bankruptcy, Enron needs a CEO who can focus 100 percent of his or her efforts on rebuilding the company.
Unfortunately, with multiple inquiries and investigations that require my immediate attention, at this time I am unable to fully concentrate on what is most important to Enron's stakeholders - preserving value for our creditors and our dedicated employees.
The Creditor Committee has begun a search for a restructuring specialist to serve as interim CEO to help the company emerge from bankruptcy.
This individual will join Enron's remaining management team to direct the company's ongoing operations.
I truly believe Enron can and will survive.
I will remain a Director of the Board to help see that it does.
During my time at Enron, I have witnessed tremendous change and opportunity.
I have seen people rigorously grow and maintain one of the world's most efficient and safest gas pipeline networks; I have seen people dedicate themselves to a cause that became a passion - the opening of energy markets; I have observed smart people come together as a team to build creative solutions like EnronOnline; and I have watched people tirelessly give of themselves to help their fellow employees and those in the community.
Regardless of what has happened, I am proud of so much of what we were able to accomplish here.
Thank you for your contributions to the company and for the inspiration you have been to me over the years.
Ken Lay
I've had to perform a system reset on my computer not once, but twice, before I was able to install these essential programs.

Subject: EnronOnline Budget Meeting

Hi Louise,

I'd like to schedule a meeting with you to discuss our plans for EnronOnline, focusing on the Origination group. My goal is to reduce expenses while still achieving significant strategic and financial benefits. Given that EA is expected to cover the majority of EOL costs in 2002, your input is crucial in finalizing our plans. Would you be available to meet on Monday before we finalize our headcount plans on Tuesday?

Thanks,
Brad

Louise--
 
I would like to meet with you in order to lay out our plans for each of the groups within EnronOnline, specifically Origination. While I plan to aggressively look at expenses, my belief is that with a reduced staff our Origination team can create significant strategic and monetary value. And since it's becoming more apparent that EA will be paying the lion's share of EOL in 2002, your input into our plans is critical. Please let me know if you have time on Monday before we need to finalize our headcount plans on Tuesday.
 
Thanks in advance,
Brad

​G​o​l​l​u​m​ ​f​r​o​m​ ​"​L​o​r​d​ ​o​f​ ​t​h​e​ ​R​i​n​g​s​"​.​<​b​r​/​>​<​b​r​/​>​D​i​s​t​r​i​c​t​ ​9​ ​h​a​s​ ​s​o​ ​m​u​c​h​ ​t​o​ ​l​i​k​e​.​ ​I​t​'​s​ ​s​p​e​c​t​a​c​u​l​a​r​,​ ​d​a​r​k​l​y​ ​f​u​n​n​y​,​ ​e​n​t​e​r​t​a​i​n​i​n​g​ ​a​n​d​ ​t​h​o​u​g​h​t​f​u​l​ ​a​l​l​ ​a​t​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​m​e​ ​t​i​m​e​,​ ​a​n​d​ ​i​t​'​s​ ​a​l​l​ ​d​o​n​e​ ​o​n​ ​a​ ​m​e​a​g​e​r​ ​$​3​0​m​ ​b​u​d​g​e​t​.​ ​T​h​e​r​e​ ​i​s​ ​t​r​u​e​ ​t​a​l​e​n​t​ ​o​n​ ​s​h​o​w​ ​h​e​r​e​.​ ​I​f​ ​o​n​l​y​ ​t​h​e​r​e​ ​w​e​r​e​ ​m​o​r​e​ ​f​i​l​m​s​ ​l​i​k​e​ ​t​h​i​s​,​ ​t​h​e​ ​w​o​r​l​d​ ​o​f​ ​c​i​n​e​m​a​ ​w​o​u​l​d​ ​b​e​ ​a​ ​m​o​r​e​ ​i​n​t​e​r​e​s​t​i​n​g​ ​p​l​a​c​e​.​

Context.

Understanding the context is essential.

This review was written in 2017, a full 12 years after the film's debut.

During this time, Marvel and DC have been fiercely competing, each striving to capitalize on every character, subplot, narrative element, and even the smallest details from their extensive collections. Regardless of quality. It's all about the profits.

A narrative as genuine as this one -- crafted by Kevin Brodbin -- could not be produced today due to its absence of the groundwork for numerous spinoffs and sequels, along with the obligatory backstory and product placements.

Featuring two of the most charming and camera-friendly actors of all time, at the height of their careers, this film presents a tale devoid of poor dialogue, inconsistencies in the story arcs, and wasted moments. Just pure, captivating cinematic enjoyment from start to finish.

Yes, I recognize that it wasn't well-received at the time. However, the future ultimately serves as the final arbiter.

Rewritten: Context.

You need context.

This review penned in 2017, some 12 years after the release.

In this period, Marvel and DC are at each other's throats, each trying to monetize every character, sub-character, plot device and dust bunny from their respective libraries. Regardless of merit. It is all about the dollars.

A story as pure as this one -- penned by Kevin Brodbin -- could never be done today because it lacks the setup for a dozen spinoffs and sequels, as well as the mandatory backstory and product placements.

Sporting two of the most charismatic and photogenic stars of all time, at the peak of their careers, we have a story with no bad lines, no lapses in the arcs, and no time wasted. Just pure, engrossing, film pleasure from beginning to end.

Yes, I know that it was not appreciated in its day. But the future is always the final judge.

The last time I attempted this, my mom simply remarked that “drugs won’t solve anything” and left it at that, but now the situation has worsened, and I want to give it another shot because I’m really struggling mentally right now. 

My parents believe that essential oils and natural remedies can cure everything, and they impose strict rules on phone usage and certain apps, which only heightens my anxiety. 

I drafted a note for my mom discussing all of this and expressing my strong belief that I have severe anxiety and depression, but I’m uncertain if I should actually hand it to her. I usually don’t feel at ease discussing serious matters like this with my parents, or even anything at all, but I’m clinging to a small glimmer of hope that I might be able to receive help and possibly some medication. There’s also the chance that they won’t respond positively and may enforce even stricter phone rules, and the fear of a negative outcome is holding me back. I really need to figure out if it’s wise to give the note to my mom, as I want assistance with all of this, but I’m terrified of it backfiring on me.

My parents are the type to think that essential oils and natural remedies work for everything, and they’re super strict on phone usage and certain apps and stuff, which doesn’t help with the anxiety at all. 

I wrote out a note to give to my mom talking about all this stuff and how I’m almost positive I have severe anxiety and depression but I’m not sure if I should actually give it to her. I don’t normally feel comfortable talking to my parents about serious things like this, or even anything at all, but I’m hanging onto the little shred of hope that I might actually be able to get help and possibly some meds to help with stuff. There’s also the possibility that they won’t react well at all and might make stricter phone rules and stuff like that and the thought of it going badly is holding me back. Hollywood is gearing up for the most significant evening in the film industry's calendar, the 77th Academy Awards, taking place on Sunday. A multitude of celebrities are anticipated to walk the red carpet outside the Kodak Theatre in Los Angeles, including Johnny Depp, Cate Blanchett, and Leonardo DiCaprio. British attendees will feature nominees Clive Owen, Imelda Staunton, Kate Winslet, and director Mike Leigh. The Aviator tops the nominations list, but critics suggest that the evening may favor Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby. A recent survey of US commentators indicated that Eastwood's boxing film has emerged as the new frontrunner for best film, surpassing the Howard Hughes biopic. Should the 74-year-old win, he would become the oldest individual ever awarded best director at the ceremony. UK critics still lean towards The Aviator for best film, yet they anticipate a fierce competition for the best director award between Eastwood and Martin Scorsese. Scorsese has yet to secure the best director accolade, despite four prior nominations for films such as Raging Bull, Goodfellas, and Gangs of New York. Eastwood has previously won best director for Unforgiven in 1993. Most analysts predict that Jamie Foxx, nominated twice, will take home the best actor award for his role as singer Ray Charles, while Imelda Staunton, star of Vera Drake, is likely to be outshone in the best actress category by Hilary Swank in Million Dollar Baby. The UK's strongest hopes rest with Clive Owen, who has already won both the Golden Globe and the Bafta for his supporting performance in Closer. Comedian Chris Rock will host the event, which will be aired with a seven-second delay to enable censors to remove any inappropriate content. "We have the bleep machine ready, but bleeps will be used as necessary," producer Gil Cates informed reporters. However, he expressed his disapproval of the increasing trend to censor live broadcasts on US television. He also downplayed concerns that Rock, known for his use of strong language in stand-up, might stir up controversy during the event. The 40-year-old comedian has already assured that he will refrain from swearing live on air during the show. "Chris has a sense of humor, and everything he says is delivered humorously," Cates remarked. "You need a movie star and a stand-up comic to navigate the ups and downs of the show." Security will be heightened, with police implementing a system to detect sarin nerve gas. "We are pulling out all the stops," stated John Miller, chief of counterterrorism at the Los Angeles Police Department. The event is "a symbol of American culture and has the potential to be a high-visibility target," he added. Meanwhile, organizers have set up a canopy over the red carpet due to a recent spell of heavy rain in Los Angeles. Cates mentioned that the covers would be taken down if the threat of rain diminished. Additionally, details have surfaced regarding this year's gift bags, which are distributed to nominees and presenters during the event. This year's bags will feature a gift certificate for a luxury beach resort, a pair of mink eyelashes, and a kitchen set complete with a year's supply of tea and coffee. The ceremony will be broadcast by the ABC network starting at 1700 local time (0100 GMT), and on Sky Movies in the UK from 0130 GMT.

Rewritten:
Hollywood is preparing for the biggest night in the film world's calendar, the 77th Academy Awards, on Sunday.
A host of stars are expected to grace the red carpet outside Los Angeles' Kodak Theatre, including Johnny Depp, Cate Blanchett and Leonardo DiCaprio. British actors in attendance include nominees Clive Owen, Imelda Staunton, Kate Winslet and director Mike Leigh. The Aviator leads the shortlist, but critics believe the night may belong to Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby. A recent poll of US pundits found Eastwood's boxing drama had become the new favourite to win best film over the Howard Hughes biopic.
If the 74-year-old does win, he will become the oldest person ever to be named best director at the ceremony. UK critics still favour The Aviator for best film, but believe the best director title will generate a close fought battle between Eastwood and Martin Scorsese.
Scorsese has never won the best director prize, despite four previous nominations for films including Raging Bull, Goodfellas and Gangs of New York. Eastwood has won best director once before, for Unforgiven in 1993. Most experts predict the twice-nominated Jamie Foxx will win best actor for his portrayal of singer Ray Charles, while Vera Drake star Imelda Staunton looks likely to lose out in the best actress field to Hilary Swank in Million Dollar Baby. The UK's highest hopes remain with Clive Owen, who has scooped both the Golden Globe and the Bafta for his supporting role in Closer. Actor and comedian Chris Rock will host the event, which will be broadcast with a seven-second time delay to allow censors to cut out any unsuitable content.
"We have the bleep machine ready, but bleeps will be used as needed," producer Gil Cates told reporters. However, he added that he strongly disapproved of the growing tendency to censor live broadcasts on US TV.
He also played down fears that Rock, who is known for using strong language in his stand-up routines, might cause controversy on the night. The 40-year-old comic has already promised not to swear live on air during the show. "Chris has a sense of humour and everything he says is really said humorously," Cates said. "You need a movie star and someone who is a stand-up comic so they can deal with the vicissitudes of the show." Security will also be tight, with police employing a system to detect sarin nerve gas. "We are pulling out all the stops," said John Miller, chief of counterterrorism at the Los Angeles Police Department. The show is "a symbol of American culture and has the potential to be a high-visibility target," he added. Meanwhile, organisers have erected a canopy over the red carpet following an outbreak of torrential rain in Los Angeles over the past week. Cates said the covers would be removed if the threat of wet weather receded. Details have also emerged of the contents of this year's gift bags, which are given to nominees and presenters on the night. This year's bags will include a gift certificate for a luxury beach resort, a pair of mink eyelashes and a kitchen set with a year's supply of tea and coffee. The event will be televised by the ABC network from 1700 local time (0100 GMT), and on Sky Movies in the UK from 0130 GMT.

We investigate how the band structure of electrodes influences transport in single-molecule junctions by measuring the conductance of pyridine-based compounds with Ag and Ni electrodes. Our research employs the scanning tunneling microscope-based break-junction technique and is corroborated by extensive density functional theory calculations. Both our observations and measurements indicate that the coupling of the primary transport orbital to the metal is less pronounced in Au-based junctions compared to Ag-based ones. We attribute this variation to quantum effects, which lead to a higher density of d-states at the Fermi energy for Au in contrast to Ag. Additionally, we demonstrate that the positioning of the conducting orbital in relation to the Fermi level does not align with the work function differences among the three metals and varies between conjugated and saturated structures. Thus, we conclude that the specifics of molecular level alignment and electronic coupling in metal-organic interfaces do not adhere to straightforward principles, but rather arise from intricate local interactions.

Rewritten:
We study the effect of electrode band structure on transport through
single-molecule junctions by determining the conductance of pyridine-based
compounds using Ag and Ni electrodes. Our studies are carried out using the
scanning tunneling microscope based break-junction method and are supported
by dense functional theory based measurements. We find from both observations
and measurements that the coupling of the dominant transport orbital to the
metal is weaker for Au-based junctions when compared with Ag-based junctions.
We attribute this difference to quantum effects, which results in an
enhanced density of d-states at the Fermi energy for Au compared with Ag. We
further show that the alignment of the conducting orbital relative to the Fermi
level does not follow the work function difference between three metals and is
different for conjugated and saturated structures. We therefore show that the
details of the molecular level alignment and electronic coupling in
metal-organic interfaces do not follow simple principles, but are instead the
result of subtle local reactions.

Rush across the western horizon, Night, with your ethereal presence.

Emerging from the misty eastern shadows, where the long and lonely daylight has passed,
You weave a tapestry of dreams, both joyful and fearful, making you both awe-inspiring and cherished.
May your journey be swift! Envelop yourself in a gray mantle adorned with stars.

Blind the eyes of the day with your dark locks; caress her until she's exhausted,
Then roam over the city, sea, and land, touching everything with your magical wand, imbuing them with a soothing sleep.
Come, long-awaited Night!

When I awoke and saw the dawn, I yearned for your return;
When the sun reached its peak, and the dew had vanished, and noon weighed heavily on flowers and trees,
And the weary day finally came to rest, lingering like an unwelcome guest,
I yearned for you.

Your brother, Death, arrived and asked, "Would you have me?" Your child, Sleep, with her dreamy eyes, whispered,
"Shall I snuggle close to your side?" "Would you have me?" Death asked again.
And I replied, "No, not yet! Death will come when you're gone, and soon, too soon;
Sleep will come when you've departed; I don't ask for either of you.
I ask only for you, beloved Night, to return soon, to bring your swift and soothing presence."

Rewritten:
Swiftly walk o'er the western wave,
Spirit of Night! 

Out of the misty eastern cave,
Where, all the long and lone daylight,
Thou wovest dreams of joy and fear,
Which make thee terrible and dear--
Swift be thy flight! Wrap thy form in a mantle gray,
Star-inwrought! 

Blind with thine hair the eyes of day;
Kiss her until she be wearied out,
Then wander o'er city, and sea, and land,
Touching all with thine opiate wand--
Come, long-sought! 

When I arose and saw the dawn,
I sighed for thee;
When light rode high, and the dew was gone,
And noon lay heavy on flower and tree,
And the weary day turned to his rest,
Lingering like an unloved guest,
I sighed for thee. Thy brother Death came, and cried,
Wouldst thou me? Thy sweet child Sleep, the filmy-eyed,
Murmured like a noontide bee,
Shall I nestle near thy side? 

Wouldst thou me?--And I replied,
No, not thee! Death will come when thou art dead,
Soon, too soon--
Sleep will come when thou art fled;
Of neither would I ask the boon
I ask of thee, beloved Night--
Swift be thine approaching flight,
Come soon, soon!

We examine the lexicographically smallest infinite \( a/b \)-power-free word over the alphabet of non-negative integers. Often, this word serves as a fixed point of a uniform morphism, or is closely associated with one. For instance, the lexicographically least \( 7/4 \)-power-free word is a fixed point of a \( 50847 \)-uniform morphism. We identify the structure of the lexicographically least \( a/b \)-power-free word for three infinite families of rationals \( a/b \) as well as several "sporadic" rationals that do not appear to belong to general families. To achieve this, we create an automated procedure for proving \( a/b \)-power-freeness for morphisms of a specific form, applicable to both explicit and symbolic rational numbers \( a/b \). Finally, we establish a connection to words over a finite alphabet. Specifically, the lexicographically least \( 27/23 \)-power-free word is indeed a word over the finite alphabet \( \{0, 1, 2\} \), and its sequence of letters is \( 353 \)-automatic.

To make this delicious peach pie, you'll need the following ingredients: 2 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 3/4 cup of cold Land O Lakes butter cut into small chunks, 5 to 7 tablespoons of cold water, 1 cup of sugar, 2 tablespoons of cornstarch, 6 medium-sized ripe peaches, 1 tablespoon of lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla, and 1 tablespoon of melted Land O Lakes butter.

To begin, preheat your oven to 400F. In a bowl, combine the flour and salt, then use a pastry blender or a fork to mix in the cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add in the water with a fork until the flour is just moistened. Divide the dough into two equal parts, shape each half into a ball, and flatten them slightly. Wrap each ball in plastic food wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Roll out one of the dough balls on a lightly floured surface into a 12-inch circle, then fold it into quarters and place it into an ungreased 9-inch pie pan. Unfold the dough and press it firmly against the bottom and sides of the pan, trimming the crust to 1/2 inch from the edge of the pan. Crimp or flute the edge of the crust to create a decorative border. Set the crust aside.

In a separate bowl, combine the sugar and cornstarch, then add the sliced peaches, lemon juice, and vanilla. Toss the mixture gently to coat the peaches evenly. Spoon the peach mixture into the prepared crust.

Roll out the remaining dough ball to a thickness of 1/8 to 1/4 inch, then use 2 to 2 1/2-inch cookie cutters to cut out shapes. Arrange the cut-outs over the filling, brush them with the melted butter, and sprinkle with sugar. Cover the edge of the crust with a 2-inch strip of aluminum foil to prevent it from burning.

Bake the pie for 35 minutes, then remove the aluminum foil and continue baking for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the crust is lightly browned and the juice begins to bubble. Serve the pie warm or cool, and enjoy!

Rewritten:
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup cold Land O Lakes Butter, cut into chunks
5 to 7 tablespoons cold water
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
6 medium (6 cups) ripe peaches, pitted, sliced 1/4-inch*
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 tablespoon Land O Lakes Butter, melted
1 teaspoon sugar
Heat oven to 400F. Combine flour and salt in bowl; cut in 3/4 cup butter with pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in enough water with fork just until flour is moistened. Divide dough in half; shape each half into ball. Flatten slightly. Wrap each ball of dough in plastic food wrap; refrigerate 30 minutes. Roll out 1 ball of dough on lightly floured surface into 12-inch circle. Fold into quarters. Place dough into ungreased 9-inch pie pan; unfold, pressing firmly against bottom and sides. Trim crust to 1/2 inch from edge of pan. Crimp or flute edge. Set aside. Combine sugar and cornstarch in bowl. Add peaches, lemon juice and vanilla; toss lightly to coat. Spoon into prepared crust. Roll remaining ball of dough to 1/8 to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out dough using 2 to 2 1/2-inch cookie cutters. Arrange cut-outs over filling. Brush with melted butter; sprinkle with sugar. Cover edge of crust with 2-inch strip of aluminum foil. Bake 35 minutes. Remove aluminum foil. Continue baking 20-25 minutes or until crust is lightly browned and juice begins to bubble. Serve warm or cool.

Sunderland FC's chairman, Bob Murray, has made a £1.5m bid to take full control of the Championship club. This move comes after he acquired BSkyB's 4.76% stake in the team, increasing his own shareholding to 42.3%. As the club's leading shareholder, Mr Murray believes that having a single majority owner will make it easier for Sunderland to attract more investment.

The club delisted its shares from the stock market in August, and Mr Murray has agreed to buy BSkyB's stake at 31p per share. Under stock market rules, he is required to make an offer for the remaining shares at the same price. If the offer is fully accepted, Mr Murray expects to pay a maximum of £1.53m for the remaining shares.

Fans who want to stay involved with the club's financial affairs can still retain a small number of shares, allowing them to attend annual meetings. Mr Murray believes that his offer will strengthen the company and reduce uncertainty, citing the recent speculation surrounding Manchester United as an example of the potential problems caused by multiple interests.

Sunderland has been working to improve its financial situation, reducing its losses from £20.6m to £1.2m last year after selling several key players. However, the club's turnover dropped sharply due to a decline in broadcast revenues. BSkyB initially acquired its stake in Sunderland in 1999 as part of a five-year media partnership deal, which expired last month.

Rewritten:
Bob Murray, chairman of Sunderland FC, has launched a £1.5m ($2.8m) bid for the club after buying broadcaster BSkyB's stake in the business. Mr Murray is already Sunderland's leading shareholder, holding a 37.6% stake, and now hopes to take full control of the Championship side. Mr Murray said the club would find it easier to attract more investment by having a single majority owner. 

Sunderland delisted its shares from the stock market in August. A lifetime Sunderland supporter and board director since 1984, Mr Murray agreed to buy BSkyB's 4.76% holding in the Wearside club on Tuesday - taking his stake to 42.3%. 

Under stock market rules, Mr Murray is required to make an offer for the remaining shares that he does not already own at the same price paid for the BSkyB holding of 31p a share. 

Should the offer be fully accepted, Mr Murray said he expected to pay a maximum of £1.53m for the remaining shares. 

He also stressed that fans who wanted to keep in touch with the club's financial affairs could retain a small number of shares, enabling them to attend annual meetings. 

"The football sector is experiencing significant changes and uncertainty," Mr Murray said in a statement. 

"The recent speculation surrounding Malcolm Glazer and Manchester United has shown the unsettling effect possible where there are a number of disparate interests," he added. "I believe that this offer will strengthen the company and remove the potential for that type of uncertainty." Sunderland were relegated from the Premiership in 2003 but are currently pushing for promotion. 

The club managed to reduce its losses last year from £20.6m to £1.2m after selling a host of leading players. However, the club's turnover dropped sharply from £42.5m to £28.5m over the same period, because of a fall in broadcast revenues. BSkyB bought its stake in Sunderland in 1999 as part of a five year media partnership deal. The deal expired last month.

Identifying tumors in medical images remains a labor-intensive process for doctors, often resulting in errors. Over the past decade, significant advancements have been made in medical image processing. Researchers have employed various mathematical techniques, including statistical modeling, voxel-based methods, and machine learning approaches. This paper presents a semi-automatic method for liver segmentation from two-dimensional CAT scans, categorizing pixels into three distinct labels: healthy tissue, veins, and tumors. Initially, a novel approach is introduced to create a feature vector for each pixel, incorporating 59 intensity values from a series of time-series data. Additionally, a simplified edge cost is incorporated into the energy function. To optimize the graph cut process, the data and edges are normalized, eliminating the need to calculate the scaling parameter lambda. As an alternative to the traditional training process, tissue means are calculated based on a sample of regions identified by expert radiologists. The proposed method offers the advantage of being relatively straightforward to implement. It has been evaluated against a gold standard on a dataset of 10 tumors, yielding an average Dice coefficient of 0.77, an average overlap error of 37%, and an average processing time of 1.25 minutes per slice.

Rewritten:
Doctors still find it a time-consuming task to detect the tumours in medical images. There are many errors in this process, and that is why in the last decade, medical image processing has made great strides in development. A variety of mathematical methods, such as statistical modelling, voxel-based methods, and machine learning methods, have been used. This paper describes a method of semi-automatic liver segmentation from two-dimensional CAT images into three labels, namely, healthy, venous and tumour. First, we introduce a new way of constructing a feature vector for each pixel consisting of 59 intensities of a series of time series and we introduce a new simplified edge cost in the energy function. We normalize the data and the edges in the energy function to optimize the graph cut without having to calculate the scaling parameter lambda. As a substitute for the training process, tissue means are calculated on a sample of regions marked out by expert radiologists. The proposed method has the advantage of being relatively easy to implement. It has been evaluated against the ground truth on a CAT dataset of 10 tumours and the average Dice coefficient is 0.77, and the average overlap error is 37%, and the average processing time is 1.25 minutes per slice.

Although Lisaar is the daughter of the most beautiful queen and the most handsome king in all the land, she is a lonely child whose only true companion is her dog, Ash. She is mostly ignored during her childhood due to the fact that her parents were the two most splendid people in all seven kingdoms. Lisaar's mother falls ill and starts to lose her beauty. This causes her to lose her will to live, because she wants to be remembered as the most beautiful person, and nothing less. She sends for artists from all the kingdoms, and eventually one is chosen to paint a portrait of her as she was before her illness. He works nonstop, as if driven, for a fortnight until the painting is completed and shown to the queen. After looking at the painting, she forces the king to swear that he will only remember her if he can find a bride more beautiful than she, and after he acquiesces, she dies. This seemingly impossible condition is, however, insurable: as Lisaar matures, she becomes not just very like her mother, but more beautiful than her parents. The king becomes obsessed with his daughter, and insists that he will marry her. Lisaar refuses him and locks herself in a room. Eventually the king finds a way into the room and rapes Lisaar and almost kills Ash. Lisaar and Ash escape from the king and find their way to a cabin in the mountains. Lisaar, impregnated by her father the king, miscarries and nearly dies. Lisaar is saved by a moon goddess, who gives her a white deerskin dress (referenced in the title) and alters both Lisaar and Ash so that they are unrecognizable; Lisaar's hair changes from black to white, and Ash grows a coat similar to that of a borzoi. As another gift, the goddess gives Lisaar time to heal and makes her forget what happened to her. Lisaar travels to a different kingdom and offers to work for the king. The prince, Osin, assigns her to raise a litter of puppies whose mother had died. The goddess's alterations, however, were more than physical. Lisaar, now identified as Deerskin, discovers that she has supernatural powers, including the ability to find lost children and objects. She falls in love with Osin and he with her, but still burdened by her past, she flees when Osin proposes to her at a ball and returns to the cabin in the mountains with Ash and the puppies. After spending the winter recovering, Deerskin feels compelled to return to Osin's city, following an urgent call. As she nears the city, she hears about a wedding and assumes it is Osin's. She realizes to her horror that the king, her father, is going to marry Osin's younger sister. Deerskin reveals her true identity as the bridegroom's daughter and calls her father to account for his actions, using the goddess's powers to punish him for his crimes. Confronting her father finally frees Lisaar to accept Osin's love. The story ends with Lisaar tentatively coming back to Osin's arms, offering to give their relationship a chance.

Quantitative image analysis frequently relies on precise classification of digitized regions through a segmentation process. However, microscope artifacts, such as the partial volume effect and noise from photographic plates, lead to variations in the intensity of the digitized values of the constituent classes, resulting in overlaps between the intensities of different classes. This overlap creates ambiguity in the digitized intensity distributions, making thresholding methods ineffective due to the unclear overlapping areas. The complexity of this ambiguity increases when more than two constituents are present, as seen in unsaturated granular media. Therefore, in such instances, a series of steps is required: initially, the ambiguous transition areas between classes are identified and removed, allowing for the global thresholding of the one-class regions; next, the transition areas are classified using a distance function; finally, both segregations are merged to create a classified image. This process incorporates three techniques for identifying transitional areas, and we have demonstrated that these techniques can effectively distinguish ambiguous transitional areas from the one-class regions with commendable accuracy across numerous digitized images. For typical noise levels in the images, the misclassification errors and area discrepancies between each class of the synthetic images and the resulting classified images ranged from 0.69-1.48 and 0.01–0.74 %, respectively, indicating that the segregation accuracy is quite satisfactory. It has been established that the method can effectively segregate x-ray microtomographic images of granular media.

Rewritten:
Quantitative image analysis often depends on an accurate classification of the digitized areas by means of a process of segmentation. But artifacts of the microscope, like the partial volume effect and noise of the photographic plates, cause a variation in the intensity of the digitized intensities of the constituent classes, and in consequence the intensities of one class overlap those of another. The result is that the digitized intensity distributions are ambiguous and that the thresholding methods do not give a satisfactory result because of the ambiguous overlap regions. The ambiguity is more complex when there are more than two constituents, as in unsaturated granular media. Consequently, in these cases it is necessary to use a sequence of steps: first, the ambiguous transition regions between the classes are located and eliminated, which enables the global thresholding of the one-class areas; then the transition regions are classified by means of a distance function, and finally both segregations are combined to produce a classified image. This sequence includes three methods of locating transitional areas, and we have shown that these methods can separate ambiguous transitional areas from the one-class regions with satisfactory accuracy on a large number of digitized images. For typical levels of noise in the images, the misclassification errors and area differences between each class of the synthetic images and the resulting classified images were 0.69-1.48 and 0.01–0.74 % respectively, showing that the accuracy of the segregation is quite satisfactory. It has been shown that the method can accurately segregate x-ray microtomographic images of granular media.

IssueAlert for March 22, 2001

New York Power Plant Plans Hit Roadblocks

by Will McNamara
Director, Electric Industry Analysis

[News item from PR Newswire] Sithe Energies, Inc. has announced that it is reassessing its plans for a power generating facility in Ramapo, New York, in response to concerns raised by local residents. The company is now considering a smaller "peaking" facility, which would use no water for generation and operate only during times of peak electricity use and emergencies to help ensure the reliability of the region's electricity supply.

Originally, the plan was for an 827-MW combined cycle facility fueled by natural gas. However, the alternative plant is a 510-MW peaking unit also powered by natural gas. Analysis suggests that Sithe Energies' original plans for the Ramapo plant have been thwarted by concerns among local residents who opposed certain aspects of the plant.

Ramapo is located 30 miles north of New York City, and the concerns of local residents centered on the fact that the original plant was planned to run all the time to meet demand, using local water resources for cooling purposes. In response to the concerns of residents, Sithe is modifying its plans for the plant and reducing its planned output.

Unfortunately, Sithe plans to move forward with a smaller peaking unit at a time when it has become increasingly clear that the state of New York has serious power supply concerns. For background, it is worth noting that Exelon Corp. owns nearly half of Sithe Energies, and the remaining 50.1 percent of Sithe is owned by Vivendi (34 percent), Marubeni Corp. (15 percent), and Sithe Management (1 percent).

Jim McGowan, Sithe senior vice president for development, referenced the role that public opposition played when he spoke about the new plans for a peaking unit in the area. "Sithe has a strong history of working closely with local communities and inviting their input to ensure their major issues are addressed," McGowan said. "We've listened carefully to [residents'] concerns and are addressing them by considering a facility that is clean, less visible, and uses no water for generation."

McGowan further noted that the new peaking plant will only operate a limited number of hours annually while fulfilling the region's growing need for electricity during times of peak consumer demand.

As an independent power producer, Sithe Energies owns power plants across the United States and internationally. The company has a generation presence in states such as California, Colorado, Massachusetts, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania. In New York, Sithe Energies owns four rather small plants and one large plant that generate approximately 1,329 MW.

In addition to the proposed peaking plant in Ramapo, Sithe Energies also has proposed Heritage Station, an 800 MW power plant located near Lake Ontario. A full siting review in New York normally takes a year to complete. However, projects under 80 MW are not required to go through the extensive environmental impact statement, which generally involves a detailed and time-consuming examination of alternatives.

The state of New York has not brought a new plant online since 1996, when a 200-MW plant opened in Brooklyn. It has been almost seven years since a 1,000 MW unit in Oswego, New York, marked the last plant to open upstate. Further, New York expects only a 3.5-percent increase in new capacity in the next three to four years. Consequently, concerns

IssueAlert for March 22, 2001=20
New York Obstacles Thwart Sithe Energies' Plans for New Power Plant=20
by Will McNamara=20
Director, Electric Industry Analysis
[News item from PR Newswire] Sithe Energies, Inc. announced that, in respon=
se=20
to issues raised by local residents, the company is reassessing its plans f=
or=20
a power generating facility in Ramapo, New York. The alternative currently=
=20
under review is a smaller "peaking" facility, which would use no water for=
=20
generation and operate only during a time of peak electricity use and=20
emergencies to help ensure reliability of the region's electricity supply.=
=20
Originally slated as an 827-MW combined cycle facility fueled by natural ga=
s,=20
the alternative plant is a 510-MW peaking unit also powered by natural gas.=
=20
Analysis: Sithe Energies' original plans for the Ramapo plant appear to hav=
e=20
been thwarted by concerns among local residents who opposed certain aspects=
=20
of the plant. Ramapo is located 30 miles north of New York City. Chief amon=
g=20
the concerns of local residents is that Ramapo plant was originally planned=
=20
to run all the time to meet demand, and as a result would use local water=
=20
resources for cooling purposes. In response to the concerns of residents,=
=20
Sithe is modifying plans for the plant and reducing its planned output.=20
Unfortunately, Sithe plans to move forward with a smaller peaking unit at t=
he=20
very time when it has become increasingly clear that the state of New York=
=20
has some rather serious power supply concerns. =20
For background, it is important to note that Exelon Corp. owns nearly half =
of=20
Sithe Energies. In December 2000, Exelon acquired 49.9 percent of the stock=
=20
of Sithe. The remaining 50.1 percent of Sithe is owned by Vivendi (34=20
percent), Marubeni Corp. (15 percent) and Sithe Management (1 percent). The=
=20
acquisition marked the continuation of an aggressive generation expansion=
=20
plan on the part of Exelon.=20
Jim McGowan, Sithe senior vice president for development, referenced the ro=
le=20
that public opposition played when he spoke about the new plans for a peaki=
ng=20
unit in the area. "Sithe has a strong history of working closely with local=
=20
communities and inviting their input to ensure their major issues are=20
addressed," McGowan said. "We've listened carefully to [residents'] concern=
s=20
and are addressing them by considering a facility that is clean, less=20
visible, and uses no water for generation." McGowan further noted that the=
=20
new peaking plant will only operate a limited number of hours annually whil=
e=20
fulfilling the region's growing need for electricity during times of peak=
=20
consumer demand.=20
As an independent power producer, Sithe Energies owns power plants across t=
he=20
United States and internationally. The company has a generation presence in=
=20
such states as California, Colorado, Massachusetts, New Jersey and=20
Pennsylvania (among several others). In New York, Sithe Energies owns four=
=20
rather small plants and one large plant that generate approximately 1,329 M=
W:=20
Batavia (58 MW), Independence Station (Scriba, N.Y., 1,042 MW), Massena (86=
=20
MW), Ogdensburg (83 MW), and Sterling (Sherill, N.Y., 60 MW). In addition t=
o=20
the proposed peaking plant in Ramapo, Sithe Energies also has proposed=20
Heritage Station, an 800 MW power plant located near Lake Ontario. A full=
=20
siting review in New York normally takes a year to complete. However,=20
projects under 80 MW are not required to go through the extensive=20
environmental impact statement, which generally involves a detailed=01*and =
time=20
consuming=01*examination of alternatives. =20
The state of New York has not brought a new plant online since 1996, when a=
=20
200-MW plant opened in Brooklyn. It has been almost seven years since a 1,0=
00=20
MW unit in Oswego, N.Y., marked the last plant to open upstate. Further, Ne=
w=20
York expects only a 3.5-percent increase in new capacity in the next three =
to=20
four years. Consequently, concerns about the state's ability to meet=20
increasing demand for power have gained momentum, heightened by the ongoing=
=20
problems in California. Pressure has been placed on New York regulators to=
=20
expedite the approval steps for siting new plants in the state. However, at=
=20
the same time, environmental groups closely guard the proposals for new=20
plants and often lobby for limitations on how and where the new plant will=
=20
produce power. This appears to be the case in Sithe Energies' Ramapo plant,=
=20
which is proceeding on the condition that it will not use water resources t=
o=20
generate power.=20
While other new plants are being planned in New York, realistically it will=
=20
be two years or more before they come online and provide sufficient capacit=
y=20
to ease concerns about shortages. Meanwhile, the state enters this summer's=
=20
season with significant doubts about its ability to meet power demands. "Ne=
w=20
York City, like other areas of the Northeast, the Midwest and California, i=
s=20
in a very serious situation," reported a member of the New York Public=20
Service Commission to the New Assembly. =20
While the entire state of New York is subject to shortages, the problem=20
appears to be particularly acute in New York City. A November 2000 FERC=20
report entitled "Investigation of Bulk Power Markets, Northeast Region,"=20
highlights specific capacity problems in the New York City/Long Island=20
community of 11 million people. These areas are particularly vulnerable=20
because they are isolated from most of the state's grid, the study says. Li=
ke=20
northern California, which suffered rolling blackouts due to transmission=
=20
constraints, New York City and Long Island can only import limited quantiti=
es=20
of power on constrained transmission lines. Hydro and fossil resources are=
=20
plentiful in upstate New York, but cannot reach the city. Being both densel=
y=20
populated and heavily residential, it is difficult to site new power plants=
=20
in the area. Consequently, 80 percent of the power that the city consumes i=
s=20
generated by the city. New plants are being proposed because New York City=
=20
reportedly will be 300 MW short of its required 8,428-MW generating capacit=
y=20
needs this summer. That projected shortfall is expected to increase by=20
another 200 MW by summer 2002. =20
Increased demand is causing additional problems for the energy markets of N=
ew=20
York City and New York State. Demand in the state rose by 2,700 MW from 199=
5=20
to 2000, or 2.5 times as fast as new generation capacity was added. This=20
year's demand is expected to reach 31,100 MW, or about 3.7 percent above=20
regulators' earlier forecasts. According to the FERC report, New York City'=
s=20
load should reach 10,535 MW this summer alone, requiring 8,428 MW of in-cit=
y=20
capacity, along with imports, to meet demand and provide a reserve margin.=
=20
With a current capacity of 8,132 MW, there is a potential 296 MW shortfall.=
=20
Long Island has a potential 131 MW shortfall to meet the required 4,653 MW =
of=20
power. =20
The report confirms earlier projections by FERC Chairman Curt HSbert and=20
others that unless New York gets additional generation capacity online with=
in=20
the next few months, the state could suffer some of California's problems.=
=20
However, despite the need for additional power generation in the state, the=
=20
intense public scrutiny of Sithe's plant in Ramapo echoes similar protests=
=20
from environmental groups and politicians for new generation plants=20
throughout the state. For instance, the New York Power Authority's (NYPA)=
=20
plan to install ten 44-MW combustion turbines by June was met with oppositi=
on=20
from environmental groups like the New York Public Interest Research Group=
=20
(NYIRG), which has sued the NYPA, charging that it circumvented the=20
environmental review process for siting new plants. In addition, FERC's=20
report included data from the New York ISO indicating that there were=20
approximately 74 projects proposed to be built in New York State (as of=20
November 2000). The report indicated that only one of these projects is=20
likely to be built in the next three to four years.=20
Although Sithe has modified its plans into a smaller peaking unit, McGowan=
=20
has reiterated that New York should not fall behind in meeting its energy=
=20
requirements. If it does, it will make the same mistakes for which Californ=
ia=20
is now paying a tremendous price. Along the same lines, William Muesler, CE=
O=20
of the New York ISO, recently said that to avoid a replication of=20
California's market meltdown, New York must move quickly to build more powe=
r=20
plants. Muesler cited that 8,600 MW of new power plant capacity, 25 percent=
=20
more than is currently available, must be constructed in New York by 2005 o=
r=20
shortages will become likely, pushing up prices and increasing the odds of=
=20
rolling blackouts. =20
However, despite these clear warnings about the need for new power plants,=
=20
"not in my back yard" has been a common response in New York. Even New=20
Jersey's acting Governor Donald T. DiFrancesco has joined the ranks of thos=
e=20
opposing new power plants in the region. DiFrancesco reportedly told a=20
meeting of about a dozen North Jersey mayors who oppose new power plants th=
at=20
he has created a task force to help opponents of various power plant projec=
ts=20
in New York and New Jersey. Included in the task force are members of=20
DiFrancesco's own staff, the state Department of Environmental Protection a=
nd=20
the Attorney General's Office. Moreover, although California offers a clear=
=20
picture of the ramifications that can result from not establishing adequate=
=20
supply, New York appears to be heading down a similar path. Although=20
California and New York have different restructuring models, one market=20
factor is the same in both states: supply that cannot meet demand. We know=
=20
the toll that this inequity has had on California. Is it only a matter of=
=20
time before New York suffers the same consequences?=20

I require a choice for a clumsy girl.

Rewritten:
I need a clumsy girl option.

I'm desperate to improve my life, face my fears, reduce my anxiety, and boost my mood. I want to have a life, a social life, and eventually, but I'm struggling to find the motivation to do so. I have no friends, my family is abusive, I have no money for therapy or medication, and I'm unable to get a job due to my severe anxiety. I'm seriously considering going back to high school, then to university, but the problem is that I have no one to emotionally support me and no social life. I don't see the point in getting better if my life isn't worth sharing. How can I overcome this? How can I make myself do the things I want to do, hoping that one day I'll live the life I've always dreamed of, but having nothing to fight for or enjoy in the present moment?

6 quarts of water  
3 tablespoons coarse salt  
3 to 4 bunches (3 to 4 pounds) white asparagus, peeled and with tough ends of stalks trimmed by 1 inch  
Hollandaise Sauce (recipe follows)  
2 cups (4 sticks) unsalted butter  
6 large egg yolks  
1/3 cup dry white wine  
2 tablespoons water  
2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice  
Coarse salt  
Cayenne pepper (optional)  
(makes 3 cups)  
Bring the water to a boil in a large stockpot, then add the salt. Place the asparagus spears in the boiling water; cook just until tender, about 5 minutes. Carefully transfer to a colander to drain, taking care not to damage the tips. Pat dry with paper towels, and arrange on a large serving platter. Serve warm with hollandaise sauce.  
To clarify the butter: Slowly melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat, skimming off any surface foam. Pour the clear layer of butter into a large glass measuring cup, leaving behind the milky residue, which can be discarded. Allow the butter to cool until it is lukewarm. Meanwhile, place the egg yolks and wine in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water. Whisk vigorously until the mixture is very pale and the whisk leaves a trail, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat; continue whisking until the mixture is the same temperature as the butter, about 30 seconds. While whisking constantly, add the butter to the egg mixture, one drop at a time at first, gradually increasing to a steady stream. Once fully incorporated, stir in the water and lemon juice, and season with salt and cayenne pepper, if desired. Serve immediately, or keep warm over a pan of simmering water removed from heat.

​w​a​t​e​r​;​ ​c​o​o​k​ ​j​u​s​t​ ​u​n​t​i​l​ ​t​e​n​d​e​r​,​ ​a​b​o​u​t​ ​5​ ​m​i​n​u​t​e​s​.​ ​G​e​n​t​l​y​ ​t​r​a​n​s​f​e​r​ ​t​o​ ​a​ ​c​o​l​a​n​d​e​r​ ​t​o​ ​d​r​a​i​n​,​ ​b​e​i​n​g​ ​o​v​e​r​ ​m​e​d​i​u​m​ ​h​e​a​t​,​ ​a​n​d​ ​s​k​i​m​ ​o​f​f​ ​s​u​r​f​a​c​e​ ​f​o​a​m​.​ ​P​o​u​r​ ​t​h​e​ ​c​l​e​a​r​ ​l​a​y​e​r​ ​o​f​ ​b​u​t​t​e​r​ ​i​n​t​o​ ​a​ ​l​a​r​g​e​ ​g​l​a​s​s​ ​4​ ​m​i​n​u​t​e​s​.​ ​R​e​m​o​v​e​ ​f​r​o​m​ ​h​e​a​t​;​ ​c​o​n​t​i​n​u​e​ ​w​h​i​s​k​i​n​g​ ​u​n​t​i​l​ ​t​h​e​ ​m​i​x​t​u​r​e​ ​i​s​ ​t​h​e​ ​s​a​m​e​ ​t​e​m​p​e​r​a​t​u​r​e​ ​a​s​ ​t​h​e​ The internet is set to expand with the introduction of two new domain names, specifically designed for mobile services and the jobs industry. The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (Icann) has given the green light to three new domain names, including .mobi and .jobs, as part of a larger initiative to introduce 10 new names. These new additions include a domain for the postal sector (.post), the travel industry (.travel), and an anti-spam domain, in addition to .mobi and .jobs.

The .mobi domain is intended for websites and products that primarily cater to cellular devices, while the .jobs domain will be used by businesses to create dedicated sites for job postings. However, it's worth noting that the process of implementing these new domain names will be a lengthy one, and Icann officials have cautioned that there are no guarantees they will be approved. The application process for these new domain names came with a hefty price tag of £23,000 per proposal, with the application for .mobi being sponsored by technology companies such as Samsung, Nokia, and T-Mobile.

Among the 10 new domain names currently under consideration, the .xxx domain for pornographic publications is considered the least likely to be approved. Despite the growing number of domain names in use worldwide, with over 250 currently available, the .com domain remains the most recognizable and widely used address on the internet.

Rewritten:
The internet will now have two new domain names, aimed at mobile services and the jobs industry.
The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (Icann) has granted final authorization to three new addresses - .mobi and .jobs. They are among 10 new names being identified by the net's oversight body. Others include a domain for pornography, an anti-spam domain as well as .post and .travel, for the postal and travel sectors.
The .mobi domain can be aimed at websites and other products that work primarily around cellular devices, while the .jobs address would be used by businesses wanting a dedicated site for job postings. The process to get the new domain names go live in cyberspace would take years and Icann officials warned that there were no promises they could eventually be considered. Applicants paid £23,000 apiece to have their proposals accepted. The application for .mobi was sponsored by technology companies including Samsung, Nokia and T-Mobile.
Of the 10 currently under consideration, the least likely to win acceptance is the .xxx domain for pornographic publications. There are now over 250 domain names in usage across the world, mainly for certain regions such as .fr for Europe and .uk for England. Yet surprisingly, .com remains the most famous address on the internet.
I'm not sure how to put my feelings into words, but I want you to know that I'm thinking of you and your wife during this difficult time, and I hope you both find some comfort and peace.

Rewritten:
I'm no good expressing condolences, but I hope you and your wife find solace in your time of grief.

Advanced image segmentation techniques typically involve at least two sequential and separate processes: a boundary detection phase that utilizes local image data to identify locations as boundaries between different objects, followed by a pixel grouping phase, such as watershed or connected components, that aggregates pixels into segments. Previous research has explored various complexities and methodologies in these two phases, including the use of multi-layer neural networks for boundary prediction and the application of global optimizations during pixel clustering. We introduce a cohesive and end-to-end trainable machine learning method, known as flood-filling networks, where a recurrent 3D convolutional network directly generates distinct segments from a raw image. This method effectively segments images containing an unknown and varying number of objects, as well as objects of highly diverse sizes. We showcase this technique on a demanding 3D image segmentation challenge, specifically connectomic reconstruction from volume electron microscopy data, where flood-filling neural networks significantly enhance accuracy compared to other leading methods. This proposed technique can streamline intricate multi-step segmentation processes into a single neural network that is trained end-to-end.

Rewritten:
State-of-the-art image segmentation algorithms generally consist of at least
two successive and distinct computations: a boundary detection process that
uses local image information to classify image locations as boundaries between
objects, followed by a pixel grouping step such as watershed or connected
components that clusters pixels into segments. Prior work has varied the
complexity and approach employed in these two steps, including the
incorporation of multi-layer neural networks to perform boundary prediction,
and the use of global optimizations during pixel clustering. We propose a
unified and end-to-end trainable machine learning approach, flood-filling
networks, in which a recurrent 3d convolutional network directly produces
individual segments from a raw image. The proposed approach robustly segments
images with an unknown and variable number of objects as well as highly
variable object sizes. We demonstrate the approach on a challenging 3d image
segmentation task, connectomic reconstruction from volume electron microscopy
data, on which flood-filling neural networks substantially improve accuracy
over other state-of-the-art methods. The proposed approach can replace complex
multi-step segmentation pipelines with a single neural network that is learned
end-to-end.

Like a shattered Cinderella,  
She hands in the jewelry box,  
There is no exit, no escape, no hope,  
And she is dangling from a noose rope.  
Shattered Cinderella, shattered Cinderella,  
You're finished; a broken record,  
That cannot play, pain here to remain,  
No beauty to flee to,  
No moving ahead, only moving back,  
Trapped, lifeless, deceased, over and shattered,  
With a tattered dress, a torn gown,  
That is ripped at the seams,  
Torn in her agony, she searches,  
But can find no one with a remedy.  
Her shoes, long since worn out,  
Leave her traversing a lonely path,  
Almost crawling on the ground,  
Her heart a vacant, cold stone,  
With many heavy stones in the burden.  
She longs for mercy from the blazing sun,  
She wished for mercy from the frigid snow,  
Where is the window? she inquires,  
Where is my future? A shattered Cinderella,  
Broken, down and out,  
Living all by herself,  
With no helping hand,  
With no friend or stranger to comprehend.  
And she yearns to be mended,  
She hopes to replace those bricks,  
That will create her a new home,  
A world where her heart carries no stone,  
And leaves her to soar in the blue sky,  
Her wings carrying her,  
From the unforgiving ground.

Rewritten:
Lіkе а brоkеn Сіndеrеllа,
Shе turns іn thе jеwеllеrу bох,
Τhеrе іs nо ехіt, nо еsсаре, nо hоре,
Αnd shе іs hаngіng frоm а nооsе rоре.
Вrоkеn Сіndеrеllа, brоkеn Сіndеrеllа,
Yоu'rе оvеr; а brоkеn rесоrd,
Тhаt саnnоt рlау, раіn hеrе tо stау,
Νо рrеttіnеss tо еsсаре tо,
Νо mоvіng fоrwаrd, оnlу mоvіng bасk,
Τrарреd, dеаd, dесеаsеd, оvеr аnd brоkеn,
Wіth а tоrn drеss, а tоrn gоwn,
Τhаt іs rірреd аt thе sеаms,
Rірреd іn hеr аgоnу, shе sеаrсhеs,
Βut саn fіnd nо оnе wіth а sоlutіоn.
Неr shоеs, lоng sіnсе wоrn оut,
Lеаvе hеr wаlkіng а lоnеlу rоаd,
Αlmоst сrаwlіng оn thе grоund,
Неr hеаrt аn еmрtу, соld stоnе,
Wіth mаnу hеаvу stоnеs іn thе lоаd.
Shе wіshеs fоr mеrсу frоm thе hоt sun,
Shе wіshеd fоr mеrсу frоm thе соld snоw,
Whеrе іs thе wіndоw? shе аsks,
Whеrе іs mу futurе? Α brоkеn Сіndеrеllа,
Βrоkеn, dоwn аnd оut,
Lіvіng аll bу hеrsеlf,
Wіth nо hеlріng hаnd,
Wіth nо frіеnd оr strаngеr tо undеrstаnd.
Αnd shе уеаrns tо bе fіхеd,
Shе hореs tо rерlасе thоsе brісks,
Τhаt wіll mаkе hеr а nеw hоmе,
Α wоrld whеrе hеr hеаrt саrrіеs nо stоnе,
Аnd lеаvеs hеr tо flу іn thе bluе skу,
Ηеr wіngs саrrуіng hеr,
Frоm thе unfоrgіvіng grоund.

Black July (Kaluu Juliya) was an anti-Tamil pogrom that took place in Sri Lanka in July 1983. The violence was premeditated and was ultimately triggered by a deadly ambush on 23 July 1983, which resulted in the deaths of 13 Sri Lanka Army soldiers, carried out by the Tamil militant group Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE). Although initially orchestrated by members of the ruling UNP, the pogrom quickly escalated into widespread violence with significant public involvement. On the night of 24 July 1983, anti-Tamil riots erupted in the capital city of Colombo and subsequently spread to other regions of the country. Over the course of seven days, predominantly Sinhalese mobs attacked, burned, looted, and killed Tamil civilians. Estimates of the death toll ranged from 400 to 3,000, and approximately 150,000 people were displaced. Around 8,000 homes and 5,000 shops were destroyed. The economic impact of the riots was estimated to be $300 million. The NGO International Commission of Jurists characterized the pogrom as a genocide in a report published in December 1983.

Sir Alex Ferguson has called on the Football Association to punish Arsenal's Thierry Henry for a reckless incident involving Gabriel Heinze. Ferguson believes Henry deliberately caught Heinze on the head with his knee during United's contentious win. He compared the tackle to Ruud van Nistelrooy's foul on Ashley Cole, for which he received a three-game ban. "We shall present it to the FA and see what they do," he said. Clubs are permitted to ask the FA to examine specific incidents, but information is expected to be provided within 48 hours of the game. The clash occurred moments before half-time when a Freddie Ljungberg challenge left Heinze on the ground on the left touchline. Henry, following the ball, attempted to hurdle the Argentine but his knee collided with the back of Heinze's head.

The striker protested his innocence - and referee Mike Riley deemed the collision accidental. Ferguson was also upset by Arsenal's overall discipline during the heated encounter between the two arch-rivals and praised his own side's behavior. "Eden produced a terrible tackle on Scholes that was a potential leg-breaker," he said. "There were 24 fouls in the game by Arsenal, seven on Heinze, five on Ronaldo, six by Vieira - and it was only his sixth foul that got him booked. Phil Neville got booked for his first challenge. "I am proud of my players for the way they handled that pressure. "We have always been good at being gracious in defeat. What happened on Sunday overshadowed our achievement, but then they do it all the time, don't they?"

Here, we investigate noisy transitional flows in imperfect millimeter-scale channels. To probe these flows, we employ microantilever sensors embedded in the channel walls. We conduct experiments in two nominally identical channels. The distinct sets of imperfections in the two channels result in two random flows where high-order moments of near-wall fluctuations differ by orders of magnitude. Interestingly, however, the lowest-order statistics in both cases appear qualitatively similar and can be described by a proposed noisy Landau equation for a slow mode. The noise, regardless of its origin, regularizes the Landau singularity of the relaxation time and makes transitions driven by different noise sources appear similar.

As she swung her knife, it sliced through the air, narrowly missing its target, and simultaneously, she felt a crushing blow to her stomach, forcing her to gasp for air. She stumbled to a halt, taking a moment to catch her breath before regaining her balance. Her expression turned grim as she pondered the limitations of her current form. She had hoped for something more resilient, something that would make her less vulnerable to attack. Instead, she decided to adopt a defensive strategy, holding back and waiting for her opponent to make the next move. By studying his techniques, she might be able to identify a weakness and catch him off guard in the future.

Rewritten:
She spun around as she slashed her knife at his neck, feeling the blade catch on skin and come free again, all in the space of an instant. At the same time she felt something that felt like a fist ram into her gut, driving the breath out of her. She skidded to a stop, taking a moment to regain her breath enough to straighten up again. Grimly, she wondered why she hadn't gotten something that made her a little more difficult to hurt than wings. Instead of attacking, this time, she hung back, waiting for him to try his own attack. If she could figure out the techniques he used to fight she might be able to circumvent them and catch him unawares at some point.

Winnie Barringer is struggling to cope with the loss of her best friend Iggie, whose family has relocated to Japan. Her curiosity is piqued when she notices a new family, the Garbers, moving into Iggie's old house. The fact that the Garbers are a black family fascinates Winnie, and she soon forms a bond with the three kids. However, not everyone in the community is welcoming of the Garbers. Winnie's neighbour, Mrs. Landon, is determined to have them leave, and she organises a petition to pressure the family into moving. Despite her parents' apparent indifference, Winnie is deeply disturbed by their lack of support. Mrs. Landon's actions escalate when she posts a harassing sign on the Garbers' lawn, prompting Winnie to create a questionnaire to gauge the community's attitudes towards black people. The Garber kids accuse Winnie of befriending them solely because she thinks it's trendy, causing a rift between them. The Garber parents are seriously considering a move, which would be devastating for Winnie. Mrs. Landon's visit to Winnie's parents is a turning point, as she not only complains about Winnie's questionnaire but also announces her own plans to leave the area. In the ensuing argument, Winnie confronts Mrs. Landon about her racist views. The next morning, Winnie discovers that her parents are indeed considering a move, which prompts her to contemplate a drastic solution: becoming a stowaway to join Iggie in Japan. However, Winnie eventually makes amends with the Garbers, and it's revealed that neither they nor her parents have ultimately decided to leave.

Rewritten:
Winnie Barringer misses her best friend Iggie, whose family has moved to Japan. She is fascinated that a black family, the Garbers, have moved into Iggie's old house. She soon becomes friends with the three kids. Another neighbour, Mrs. Landon, organises a petition to pressure the Garbers into moving. Much to Winnie's distress, her parents seem ambivalent on the issue, though they do not sign the petition. Mrs. Landon later nails a harassing sign to the Garbers' lawn. Winnie creates a questionnaire to determine community members' attitudes about blacks, hoping to raise support for the Garbers. She has an argument with the Garber kids, however, who accuse her of befriending them only because she thinks having black friends is cool. The Garber parents are seriously considering moving. Mrs. Landon visits Winnie's parents again. She not only complains about Winnie's questionnaire, but also announces that she will be moving away and tries to pressure the Barringers to move. Mr. Barringer flatly refuses, and in the ensuing argument Winnie confronts Mrs. Landon about her racism. The next morning, Winnie discovers that her parents really are considering moving. She decides that if they do, she will become a stowaway and go to live with Iggie in Japan. But soon she makes up with the Garbers, and finds that neither they nor her parents have ultimately decided to move.

If we're all going to be in the same place, I wonder if we'll all be playing the same instrument. It's possible that we'll instantly know how to play, and we won't need to take music lessons. I was thinking about this because I'd really like to have a Hammond organ available to play. It would be fantastic to be able to play it right away, especially with the added sound of the Leslies. In the real world, the B3 organ is quite heavy, but I suppose that won't be a problem in the afterlife. Perhaps everything will be lighter, or maybe there will be people to help us move it.

I was wondering if I'm assuming too much, but then I thought, maybe we'll all be too lazy to move the furniture. So, I had an idea - what if we could have some people from the other place on a temporary visit? I mean, just the ones who deserve a break, not the ones who have committed serious crimes. A few shoplifters might be a good fit for this role. They might find moving the organ to be the most appealing job in the world, especially after experiencing the hardships they've faced. It's just a thought, but I'd love to hear your opinion on it.

Rewritten:
When we go, will we all be playing the harp? If we do, I suppose we shall know how to play at once; I don’t suppose we shall have to take lessons. (You know how boring it is, with all those scales.) The reason I ask is that, if I may ask (politely), might I not ask to have a Hammond organ, with the ability to play it at once? That would be swell, especially through the Leslies! In real life the B3 is so heavy, but I suppose that in Heaven no one would have any trouble with it, either because everything will be light or because there will be men to move it for us. Am I assuming too much? You know, perhaps everybody in Heaven will be too lazy to move furniture. So I was thinking — tell me if it’s a bad idea — that we could have some of the people from Hell. I mean, we could have them on pass from the gyrations. Just the ones who deserve a break. No murderers, of course, only a few shoplifters. I’m sure that moving the organ would seem like the sexiest job in the world to them, after having been nailed to the prongs of a pitchfork or beaten with a bullwhip or whatever. It’s just a thought, you understand. What do you think?
