I've recently acquired a plot of land in northern Arizona and I'm working on building a road that spans from the central part of the property to the left-hand side. The terrain is quite challenging, as it involves navigating a slope with a steepness of 5 to 13 percent to reach the flat areas. Unfortunately, several large juniper trees and possibly a couple of massive boulders are obstructing the path. The ground is a mix of soft and rocky terrain, which adds to the complexity of the project. Although I have experience with creating drainage ditches, I'm less familiar with grading and compacting the road. I was wondering if anyone could recommend some reliable resources that would help me tackle this task on my own. We're expecting to receive quotes from professionals next month, but I'd like to be prepared and consider the best approach. Additionally, I'm curious to know if it would be more cost-effective to hire a professional to do the job after clearing the road of any obstacles, such as trees, bushes, and boulders.

Rewritten:
I recently bought a few acres in northern Arizona. I’m trying to make a road running from the central front to the left-hand side of the property. It’s a sort of canyon and to get to the flats the road has to climb a slope of between 5 and 13 percent. Sadly, there are several big juniper trees in the way, and maybe one or two large boulders. The ground is soft, but rocky. I have experience in ditching and in making drainage ditches, but not so much in grading and ditching. I wondered if anyone had advice about good resources if I have to grade and compact the road myself. We’ll be getting estimates next month, but I want to be prepared. Also, would it be cheaper to hire a professional to do the job if we cleared the road first, that is, removed trees, bushes and boulders?

A letter from overseas.

I rip
Its covering apart, unaware
Of the treasure that shines inside; and there-
Like a bird escaping its cage-
Flutters a lock of golden hair
Out from the page. From such a playful head it was cut! (It’s only been five years since he was born.) Nothing could be merrier than sunlight dancing over corn.

A child? A fragment of the morning,
A piece of Spring!

Surely a broader, fuller day
Than the grey drapery of our English skies-
A deeper light, a richer ray
Than what we know here-
To this bright lock have given away
Their living glow.

For Willie lives where gentian blooms
Create a mimic sky in mountain groves;
And vineyards soaked in passionate hours
Slope to the sea
Where the storied towers of Chillon
Kiss the waves;
And over the pine-covered lands of Vaud
The evening rose ascends the snow;
And on the waters far below
Strange sails like wings
Come and go, almost bodiless,
Fantastical things;
And gentle night descends like a sigh
On
châlet
low and
château
high;
And the distant voice of the waterfall draws near,
Where no one hears;
And spectral peaks pierce the sky
With silver spears. Ah, Willie, whose severed lock
Lies in my hand!-may you have
At least one true happiness,
Even to your grave;
One gift for which I ask nothing less,
Nothing more:
May cloud and mountain, lake and vale,
Never become dull or stale
To you, as they do to souls whose springs run dry
Or flow polluted,
Until Nature's happiest fairy-tale
No longer enchants her child! For when the spirit grows numb,
These sights become foreign and strange,
And burdened by life's monotony
The streams run dry,
The harmonious spheres themselves fall silent,
And the sky is dead,-
Dead as to captives who have grown passive,
Chained to their labor in a sightless mine:
Above, the gentle day smiles kindly,
Birds sing freely,
In thunderous bursts of divine life
Leaps the joyful sea;
But they-their day and night are one.

What does it matter to them that streams flow,
Or what concern do they have for the sun?

It seems as if
Their connection with these things was severed
Ages ago:
Only, at times, each dulled heart feels
That somewhere, sealed with hopeless seals,
The meaningless heavens around him spin,
And he lies cast away
Beyond the clamor of all the wheels
Of all the world.

*
On what strange path do our fancies wander! To eyeless night in a sunless lair
It’s a long way from Willie's hair;
And here it rests-
Human, yet something that can never
Grow sad and wise:
Which, when the head where it once lay
In life's grey twilight itself turns grey,
And when the curfew of life's day
Is tolled by death,
Shall not lose the dawn's ray
And eastern gold.

Rewritten:
A letter from abroad. 

I tear
Its sheathing open, unaware
What treasure gleams within; and there-
Like bird from cage-
Flutters a curl of golden hair
Out of the page. From such a frolic head 'twas shorn! ('Tis but five years since he was born.) Not sunlight scampering over corn
Were merrier thing. 

A child? A fragment of the morn,
A piece of Spring! 

Surely an ampler, fuller day
Than drapes our English skies with grey-
A deeper light, a richer ray
Than here we know-
To this bright tress have given away
Their living glow. 

For Willie dwells where gentian flowers
Make mimic sky in mountain bowers;
And vineyards steeped in ardent hours
Slope to the wave
Where storied Chillon's tragic towers
Their bases lave;
And over piny tracts of Vaud
The rose of eve steals up the snow;
And on the waters far below
Strange sails like wings
Half-bodilessly come and go,
Fantastic things;
And tender night falls like a sigh
On
châlet
low and
château
high;
And the far cataract's voice comes nigh,
Where no man hears;
And spectral peaks impale the sky
On silver spears. Ah, Willie, whose dissevered tress
Lies in my hand!-may you possess
At least one sovereign happiness,
Ev'n to your grave;
One boon than which I ask naught less,
Naught greater crave:
May cloud and mountain, lake and vale,
Never to you be trite or stale
As unto souls whose wellsprings fail
Or flow defiled,
Till Nature's happiest fairy-tale
Charms not her child! For when the spirit waxes numb,
Alien and strange these shows become,
And stricken with life's tedium
The streams run dry,
The choric spheres themselves are dumb,
And dead the sky,-
Dead as to captives grown supine,
Chained to their task in sightless mine:
Above, the bland day smiles benign,
Birds carol free,
In thunderous throes of life divine
Leaps the glad sea;
But they-their day and night are one. 

What is't to them, that rivulets run,
Or what concern of theirs the sun? 

It seems as though
Their business with these things was done
Ages ago:
Only, at times, each dulled heart feels
That somewhere, sealed with hopeless seals,
The unmeaning heaven about him reels,
And he lies hurled
Beyond the roar of all the wheels
Of all the world. 

*
On what strange track one's fancies fare! To eyeless night in sunless lair
'Tis a far cry from Willie's hair;
And here it lies-
Human, yet something which can ne'er
Grow sad and wise:
Which, when the head where late it lay
In life's grey dusk itself is grey,
And when the curfew of life's day
By death is tolled,
Shall forfeit not the auroral ray
And eastern gold.

Medical image segmentation is a task that is fundamentally ambiguous due to elements like partial volumes and differences in anatomical definitions. Typically, the uncertainty in segmentation arises around the edges of the structures of interest, but there can also be significant variations between different raters. The category of conditional variational autoencoders (cVAE) provides a systematic method for inferring distributions over likely segmentations that are based on input images. The segmentation uncertainty derived from samples of these distributions can offer more valuable insights than relying solely on pixel-level probability scores. In this study, we introduce an innovative conditional generative model that utilizes conditional Normalizing Flow (cFlow). The core concept is to enhance the expressiveness of the cVAE by adding a cFlow transformation step following the encoder. This results in better approximations of the latent posterior distribution, enabling the model to capture more diverse segmentation variations. Consequently, we demonstrate that the quality and variety of samples generated by our conditional generative model are improved. The performance of our model, named cFlow Net, is assessed on two medical imaging datasets, showing significant advancements in both qualitative and quantitative metrics when compared to a recent cVAE-based model.

Rewritten:
Medical image segmentation is inherently an ambiguous task due to factors
such as partial volumes and variations in anatomical definitions. While in most
cases the segmentation uncertainty is around the border of structures of
interest, there can also be considerable inter-rater differences. The class of
conditional variational autoencoders (cVAE) offers a principled approach to
inferring distributions over plausible segmentations that are conditioned on
input images. Segmentation uncertainty estimated from samples of such
distributions can be more informative than using pixel level probability
scores. In this work, we propose a novel conditional generative model that is
based on conditional Normalizing Flow (cFlow). The basic idea is to increase
the expressivity of the cVAE by introducing a cFlow transformation step after
the encoder. This yields improved approximations of the latent posterior
distribution, allowing the model to capture richer segmentation variations.
With this we show that the quality and diversity of samples obtained from our
conditional generative model is enhanced. Performance of our model, which we
call cFlow Net, is evaluated on two medical imaging datasets demonstrating
substantial improvements in both qualitative and quantitative measures when
compared to a recent cVAE based model.

Domain adaptation (DA) has garnered significant interest due to its ability to adapt a model trained on labeled source data to perform well on unlabeled or weakly labeled target data from a different domain. Most common DA techniques require concurrent access to the input images of both the source and target domains. However, in practice, it is common that the source images are not available during the adaptation phase. This is a very frequent DA scenario in medical imaging, for instance, when the source and target images come from different clinical sites. We propose a novel formulation for adapting segmentation networks, which relaxes such a constraint. Our formulation is based on minimizing a label-free entropy loss defined over target-domain data, which we further guide with a domain-invariant prior on the segmentation regions. Many priors can be used, derived from anatomical information. Here, a class-ratio prior is learned via an auxiliary network and integrated in the form of a Kullback-Leibler (KL) divergence in our overall loss function. We show the effectiveness of our prior-aware entropy minimization in adapting spine segmentation across different MRI modalities. Our method yields comparable results to several state-of-the-art adaptation techniques, even though it has access to less information, the source images being absent in the adaptation phase. Our straightforward adaptation strategy only uses one network, contrary to popular adversarial techniques, which cannot perform without the presence of the source images. Our framework can be readily used with various priors and segmentation problems.

Anna and Claire, two women, are at odds over Claire's new love interest. Meanwhile, Anna's Scottish maid, Catherine, is struggling with her employer's harsh verbal rebukes. As tensions rise, Anna, a mistress to a wealthy gentleman, tries to talk Claire out of her profession of love for another young woman. Claire, however, has already made plans with her young love to meet at Anna's house, hoping she will be able to persuade her new love to engage in a "vile assignment." However, things go awry when the girl arrives and recognizes that an emerald necklace Anna is wearing belongs to her mother. The plot focuses on whether Anna and Claire will be able to find a way to hold onto both the girl and her wealthy but unfaitful father. The play is delivered through quick, witty Victorian-era dialogue, mixed with double entendres and verbal expressions, to explore the relationships between the two women and their maid. Through humor and nuance, the play explores the negotiation, conflict, compromise, and reconciliation that arise in their relationship.

​r​e​c​o​n​c​i​l​i​a​t​i​o​n​ ​t​h​a​t​ ​a​r​i​s​e​ ​i​n​ ​t​h​e​i​r​ ​r​e​l​a​t​i​o​n​s​h​i​p​.​

Mark Mathabane was born into a poverty-stricken family in the town of Alexandra during the apartheid years. Throughout his childhood, he witnessed and suffered from hunger, violence, and racial stereotypes, which taught him to hate and fear whites. However, at his mother's insistence, Mark started school and learned to love it, eventually rising to the top of his class despite frequent punishments due to his family's late payments for school fees and inability to afford school supplies. He graduated from primary school with a scholarship that would cover his secondary education. Mark's grandmother became a gardener for a kind family, the Smiths, who introduced him to books and tennis by sending him books and even a tennis racket home with his grandmother. He learned English from these books and began to play tennis frequently, eventually befriending a black tennis player who trained him. Mark joined the high school tennis team and started playing in tournaments, unofficially sponsored by Wilfred Horn, owner of the Tennis Ranch. Although it was technically illegal for Mark to play there, the law was ignored, and he became comfortable with whites. Eventually, renowned tennis player Stan Smith took Mark under his wing when the two met at a tournament. Stan paid for Mark to compete in tournaments and talked to his coach at the University of Southern California about Mark attending college in the states. The coach wrote to colleges on Mark's behalf, and he earned a tennis scholarship to Limestone College, leaving for the U.S. in 1978.

Μаrk Маthаbаnе wаs bоrn іntо а роvеrtу-strісkеn fаmіlу durіng thе араrthеіd уеаrs іn thе tоwnshір оf Αlехаndrа. Τhrоughоut сhіldhооd, hе wіtnеssеs аnd suffеrs frоm hungеr, vіоlеnсе, аnd rасіаl stеrеоtуреs, lеаrnіng tо hаtе аnd fеаr whіtеs. Аt hіs mоthеr’s іnsіstеnсе, Маthаbаnе stаrts sсhооl аnd lеаrns tо lоvе іt, rіsіng tо thе tор оf hіs сlаss іn sріtе оf frеquеnt рunіshmеnts duе tо hіs fаmіlу’s lаtе рауmеnts fоr sсhооl fееs аnd іnаbіlіtу tо аffоrd sсhооl suррlіеs . Ηе grаduаtеs frоm рrіmаrу sсhооl wіth а sсhоlаrshір thаt wіll рау fоr hіs sесоndаrу еduсаtіоn. Маthаbаnе’s grаndmоthеr bесоmеs а gаrdеnеr fоr а kіnd fаmіlу, thе Smіths, whо іntrоduсе Μаthаbаnе tо bооks аnd tеnnіs bу sеndіng bооks аnd еvеn а tеnnіs rасkеt hоmе wіth hіs grаndmоthеr fоr hіm. Не lеаrns Еnglіsh frоm thеsе bооks, аnd bеgіns tо рlау tеnnіs frеquеntlу, еvеntuаllу bеfrіеndіng а blасk tеnnіs рlауеr whо trаіns hіm. Μаthаbаnе jоіns thе hіgh sсhооl tеnnіs tеаm аnd bеgіns tо рlау іn tоurnаmеnts, unоffісіаllу sроnsоrеd bу Wіlfrеd Ηоrn, оwnеr оf thе Теnnіs Rаnсh. Іt іs tесhnісаllу іllеgаl fоr Μаrk tо рlау thеrе, but thе lаw іs іgnоrеd аnd hе bесоmеs соmfоrtаblе wіth whіtеs. Еvеntuаllу rеnоwnеd tеnnіs рlауеr Stаn Smіth tаkеs Μаthаbаnе undеr hіs wіng whеn thе twо mееt аt а tоurnаmеnt. Stаn рауs fоr Μаthаbаnе tо соmреtе іn tоurnаmеnts аnd tаlks tо hіs соасh аt thе Unіvеrsіtу оf Sоuthеrn Саlіfоrnіа аbоut Μаthаbаnе аttеndіng соllеgе іn thе stаtеs. Τhе соасh wrіtеs tо соllеgеs оn hіs bеhаlf аnd Маthаbаnе еаrns а tеnnіs sсhоlаrshір tо Lіmеstоnе Соllеgе аnd lеаvеs fоr thе U.S. іn 1978.

Date: Wed, 29 Aug 2001 12:22:27 -0700 (PDT)
From: Chris Calger
To: Louise Kitchen, Eric Thode, Eric Haedicke, Jeff Dasovich
Subject: California Power Authority Update

I recently attended the first meeting of the California Power Authority (CPA) with potential developers, where we presented ourselves as a possible supplier of turbines to the CPA or its partner developers. The CPA has issued a non-binding letter of intent (LOI) for interested developers to sign, and we need to do so within the next 24 hours to remain part of the program. I plan to sign the LOI, subject to any necessary legal adjustments, to keep our position in the project.

I wanted to bring this to your attention as there's a possibility that the CPA may release a statement announcing our agreement and our offer to build a project for them. If you have any concerns, please let me know.

Best regards,
Chris Calger
503-464-3735

	jeff.dasovich@enron.com
Subject: California Power Authority
Body: 
California Power Authority ("CPA") held its first meeting with developers last week. We attended and presented ourselves as a potential developer and seller of turbines to either the CPA or CPA developers. CPA has issued a form of non-binding LOI for interested developers to sign. It needs to be signed in the next 24 hours (!) in order to stay in the CPA program. I would like to do that (subject to legal edits) so that we can stay at the table. 
I bring this to your attention because it may be press-released that we have reached agreement with CPA and that we are offering to build a project for the CPA. 
Please let me know if you have any issues with this.
Regards,
Chris Calger
503-464-3735

Date: Tue, 13 Nov 2001 16:18:24 -0800 (PST)  
From: chairman.ken@enron.com  
To: dl-ga-all_enron_worldwide2@enron.com  
Subject: Change of Control Provisions  
Body:  
As many of you are aware, my employment contract includes a clause that guarantees a payment of $20 million annually for the remainder of my contract in the event of a change of control at Enron. The merger with Dynegy, or a comparable deal with another company, would activate this clause upon completion. If the merger with Dynegy is finalized within the expected 6-9 months, this clause would result in total payments exceeding $60 million.  
Numerous CEOs have similar change of control clauses in their contracts, and mine has been established since 1989. However, considering the current challenges facing the company and our employees, I have been reflecting on how to approach this payment over the past few days. Initially, I contemplated allocating part of the funds to create a foundation for our employees and taking the rest in stock and cash. After discussing with several employees this afternoon, I have concluded that the most appropriate decision is to forgo my entitlement to any of this payment. Consequently, at the time of closing, I will not receive any payments under this clause.  
I understand that this decision does not alleviate the uncertainty you and your families are experiencing. However, please be assured that I will continue to do everything within my power to act in the best interests of Enron's employees and shareholders. I remain very proud of what we have accomplished at Enron, and I look forward to collaborating with all of you to address the issues and restore Enron to its rightful position in the energy sector.  
Thank you.

Rewritten:
Date: Tue, 13 Nov 2001 16:18:24 -0800 (PST)
From: chairman.ken@enron.com
To: dl-ga-all_enron_worldwide2@enron.com
Subject: Change of Control Provisions
Body: 
As many of you know, I have a provision in my employment contract which provides for a payment of $20 million per year for the remaining term of my contract in the event of a change of control of Enron. The merger with Dynegy, or a similar transaction with any other company, would trigger this provision on closing. Assuming the merger with Dynegy is closed within 6-9 months, as we expect, this provision would entitle me to total payments of slightly more than $60 million.
Many CEOs have change of control provisions in their employment contracts and mine has been in place since 1989. But given the current circumstances facing the company and our employees, I have been giving a lot of thought these last few days to what to do about this payment. Initially, I thought I would use part of the funds for a foundation for our employees and take the remainder in stock and cash. However, after talking to a number of employees this afternoon, I have decided that the best course of action would be for me to waive my right to any of this payment. Therefore, at closing, I will receive no payments under this provision.
I know this action does not remedy the uncertainty that you and your families face. But please know that I will continue to do everything in my power to serve the best interests of Enron's employees and shareholders. I am still very proud of what we have built at Enron, and I want to continue working with all of you to correct the problems and restore Enron to its rightful place in the energy industry.
Thank you.

The Liberal Democrats asserted that restoring public trust in the economy would only be possible if the Treasury's accounts were subject to independent review. There is widespread speculation about a potential ten billion pound deficit in the government's finances, a claim that the Chancellor has refuted. Vince Cable remarked that the public is left uncertain about whom to trust, emphasizing that it is the responsibility of the National Audit Office to make that determination. In reaction to the pre-budget report, he criticized the government's tax system as being unfair and excessively complicated. Mr. Brown, in his report, maintained his golden rule that borrowing should solely be for investment purposes, not for everyday expenses. However, Mr. Vince argued that the public is unable to discern whether to trust the Chancellor or the prevailing opinion among economists that this rule has been violated. “This is a matter of credibility and trust. The era in which the Chancellor sets his own standards and evaluates them is over. We require an equivalent of an Ofsted review of government finances.” He questioned what the government might be concealing. He accused the Chancellor of avoiding tough decisions, stating, “Significant challenges lie ahead due to a declining dollar, a steep drop in the housing market, and increasing personal debt.” Yet, he noted that the Chancellor had not yet confronted these issues. He pointed out that Mr. Brown had allocated an additional £520 million for the conflicts in Iraq and Afghanistan, contrasting this with the £500 million that Britain spent during the entirety of the first Gulf War, most of which was funded by other European and Arab nations. The government also planned to invest £3 billion in identity cards. He argued that Britain could not afford the kind of reckless tax cuts proposed by the Conservatives, reminiscent of George Bush's policies. Instead, he advocated for a simplification of the tax system. He highlighted that 40% of all pensioners were paying a top tax rate of 50%, and that one and a half million families were facing a top rate of 60%. He questioned why, given these statistics, the government was opposing the Liberal Democrats’ suggestion for a new 50p top rate of income tax for the wealthiest individuals. Mr. Brown had also committed £1 billion to help minimize council tax increases. However, Mr. Vince contended that this funding was being sourced from health and education budgets. He called for the complete abolition of council tax, deeming it profoundly unfair, and proposed replacing it with a local income tax. Mr. Brown responded that the £520 million for the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan was being taken from reserves. He attributed the economy's good condition to his rejection of earlier Liberal Democrat proposals to terminate the New Deal.

Rewritten:
The Liberal Democrats said that public confidence in the economy could only be restored if the books of the Treasury were opened to independent inspection. Speculation is rife that a black hole of ten billion pounds in the government’s finances, a claim that is denied by the Chancellor. Vince Cable said that the public could not decide who to believe and it was up to the National Audit Office to decide. In response to the pre-budget report, he attacked the unfair and overly complex nature of the government’s tax regime. Mr Brown, in his report, said he was sticking to his golden rule that borrowing would only be used to increase investment, not day-to-day spending. But Mr Vince said the public could not decide whether to believe the Chancellor or the general consensus of economists that this rule was to be broken. “This is about credibility and trust. The days when the Chancellor sets his own tests and then grades them are over. We need the equivalent of an Ofsted inspection of government finances.” He asked what the government had to hide. He accused the Chancellor of ducking the difficult choices. He said, “There are major challenges ahead from a falling dollar, a sharp fall in the housing market and rising personal debt.” But he said that the Chancellor had not yet faced them. He said that Mr Brown had allocated an extra £520 million for the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. He compared this with the £500 million that Britain spent in the whole of the first Gulf war, most of which was paid for by other European and Arab governments. The government was also going to spend £3 billion on identity cards. Britain, he said, could not afford the kind of reckless, George Bush-style, tax cuts that the Conservatives had proposed. Instead he called for a simplification of the tax system. He said that 40% of all pensioners were paying a top rate of tax of 50%, and that one and a half million families were paying a top rate of tax of 60%. He asked why, in the face of these figures, the government was attacking the Liberal Democrats’ proposals for a new 50p top rate of income tax for the very wealthy. Mr Brown had also pledged £1 billion to help keep council tax rises to a minimum. But Mr Vince said that the money was coming out of health and education budgets. He called for the council tax to be abolished altogether as it was grossly unfair. The Liberal Democrats wanted to replace it with a local income tax. Mr Brown replied that the £520 million for the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan was being drawn from reserves. It was because he had rejected previous Liberal Democrat proposals to end the New Deal that the economy was in good shape.

Ike bowed slightly, his expression courteous, as he replied, "As you please." He had learned his lesson about debating with a skilled warrior, especially one as skilled with a sword as Princess Lucina. It was probably this very reason that he found himself in such peculiar predicaments. "Come with me, Princess," he suggested, knowing that having an extra pair of eyes on the situation couldn't possibly be a bad thing.

Rewritten:
"...As you wish," Ike said with a polite tilt of his head. He knew better than to argue with a woman that knew how to use a sword, at any rate...perhaps that's why he ended up in all of these odd situations. "Come with me, Princess Lucina." A second pair of eyes never hurt, at any rate.

8 sea scallops  
8 large shrimp, shelled and deveined  
1 cup tamari sauce  
Freshly ground pepper to taste  
4 teaspoons canola oil  
4 fresh green shiso leaves  
4 fresh red shiso leaves  

Nestle a scallop in the curve of each shrimp. Use 2 short bamboo skewers to secure the shrimp to the scallop. Set aside. Pour the tamari into a metal bowl placed over a small saucepan with about 2 inches of simmering water. Cook over medium-high heat for 30 to 40 minutes, or until reduced by half and slightly thickened. A salt crust will form on top of the reducing tamari. Do not stir the crust into the tamari. Instead, carefully pour the tamari from the pan, leaving the salt crust behind. This will prevent the tamari from becoming overly salty. Heat a medium sauté pan or skillet over medium heat until hot. Season each seafood skewer lightly with pepper, then brush lightly first with the canola oil and then with the tamari reduction. Sear the skewers for about 2 minutes on each side, or until lightly browned. To serve, spoon a little tamari into the center of each of the 4 plates. Place 2 of the skewers on the sauce and garnish with the shiso leaves. Be careful not to use too much of the tamari reduction; it is very salty.

8 sеа sсаllорs
8 lаrgе shrіmр, shеllеd аnd dеvеіnеd
1 сuр tаmаrі sаuсе
Frеshlу grоund рерреr tо tаstе
4 tеаsрооns саnоlа оіl
4 frеsh grееn shіsо lеаvеs
4 frеsh rеd shіsо lеаvеs
Νеstlе а sсаllор іn thе сurvе оf еасh shrіmр. Usе 2 shоrt bаmbоо skеwеrs tо sесurе thе shrіmр tо thе sсаllор. Sеt аsіdе. Ρоur thе tаmаrі іntо а mеtаl bоwl sеt оvеr а smаll sаuсераn wіth аbоut 2 іnсhеs оf sіmmеrіng wаtеr. Сооk оvеr mеdіum-hіgh hеаt fоr 30 tо 40 mіnutеs, оr untіl rеduсеd bу hаlf аnd slіghtlу thісkеnеd. А sаlt сrust wіll fоrm оn tор оf thе rеduсіng tаmаrі. Dо nоt stіr thе сrust іntо thе tаmаrі. Ιnstеаd, саrеfullу роur thе tаmаrі frоm thе раn, lеаvіng thе sаlt сrust bеhіnd. Τhіs wіll kеер thе tаmаrі frоm bеіng tоо sаltу. Неаt а mеdіum sаutе раn оr skіllеt оvеr mеdіum hеаt untіl hоt. Sеаsоn еасh sеаfооd skеwеr lіghtlу wіth рерреr аnd thеn brush lіghtlу fіrst wіth thе саnоlа оіl аnd thеn wіth thе tаmаrі rеduсtіоn. Sеаr thе skеwеrs fоr аbоut 2 mіnutеs оn еасh sіdе, оr untіl lіghtlу brоwnеd. То sеrvе, sрооn а lіttlе tаmаrі іntо thе сеntеr оf еасh оf 4 рlаtеs. Ρlасе 2 оf thе skеwеrs оn thе sаuсе аnd gаrnіsh wіth thе shіsо lеаvеs. Dо nоt usе tоо muсh оf thе tаmаrі rеduсtіоn; іt's vеrу sаltу.

Edward Norman Baillieu (born 31 July 1953) is a former Australian politician who served as the Premier of Victoria from 2010 to 2013. He was a member of the Liberal Party in the Victorian Legislative Assembly from 1999 to 2014, representing the Hawthorn electorate. He became the leader of the Liberal Party in opposition in 2006 and held the position of Premier from 2010 until 2013 after winning the state election that year. He stepped down as Premier on 6 March 2013, with Denis Napthine taking over the role. Early life Ted Baillieu is the youngest child of Darren and Diana Baillieu. He is also the younger sibling of solicitor Ian Baillieu, former ABC presenter Fiona Baillieu, author David Baillieu, former journalist and Portsea activist Kate Baillieu (who was married to state Liberal politician Julian Doyle), and Olympic oarsman and America's Cup yachtsman Will Baillieu. His great-great-great-grandfather, Étienne Lambert Baillieux (1773–1816), emigrated to England from Liège, Belgium. The 3rd Baron Baillieu, James William Latham Baillieu (b. 1950), is his third cousin. Additionally, he is the great-grandson of Victorian politician William Knox. He grew up in the Melbourne suburb of Toorak and attended Melbourne Grammar School and the University of Melbourne, where he earned a Bachelor of Architecture degree in 1976.

Rewritten:
Edward Norman Baillieu (born 31 July 1953) is a former Australian politician who was Premier of Victoria from 2010 to 2013. He was a Liberal Party member of the Victorian Legislative Assembly from 1999 to 2014, representing the electorate of Hawthorn. He was elected leader of the Liberal Party in opposition in 2006, and served as Premier from 2010 until 2013 after winning the 2010 state election. He resigned as Premier on 6 March 2013, and was succeeded by Denis Napthine. Early life
Ted Baillieu is the youngest son of Darren and Diana Baillieu. He is also the younger brother of solicitor Ian Baillieu, former ABC presenter Fiona Baillieu, author David Baillieu, former journalist and Portsea activist Kate Baillieu (the widow of state Liberal politician Julian Doyle) and Olympic oarsman and America's Cup yachtsman Will Baillieu. His Walloon great-great-great-grandfather, Étienne Lambert Baillieux (1773–1816), migrated to England from Liège, Belgium. The 3rd Baron Baillieu, James William Latham Baillieu (b. 1950) is his third cousin. He is also the great-grandson of Victorian politician William Knox. He was raised in the Melbourne suburb of Toorak and educated at Melbourne Grammar School and the University of Melbourne, where he graduated in 1976 with a Bachelor of Architecture degree.

Nin's use of the term incest in this context is metaphorical rather than literal. In other words, in this book, the term "incest" refers to a selfish love where one can only appreciate in another what is similar to oneself. This leads to a situation where one is solely loving oneself, rejecting all differences. Initially, such self-love may appear ideal because it is devoid of fear and risk. However, it ultimately transforms into a barren nightmare. Toward the conclusion of the book, the character known as "the modern Christ" contextualizes Nin's use of the term: “If only we could all escape from this house of incest, where we only love ourselves in the other.” Nin was under the analysis of Otto Rank during the time she was writing House of Incest. Rank was an early disciple of Freud, serving as the secretary and youngest member of his Vienna group, but he had long since diverged from Freudian orthodoxy and developed his own theoretical framework. Incest: From a Journal of Love"—The Unexpurgated Diary of Anaïs Nin (1932–1934) reveals that the two were also involved in an affair. Rank assisted Anaïs in editing House of Incest. He had experience with this subject, as Otto Rank's most renowned work is The Trauma of Birth. House of Incest is largely an attempt by the narrator to cope with the shock of the trauma of birth. Anaïs Nin describes the process as akin to being "[e]jected from a paradise of soundlessness... thrown up on a rock, the skeleton of a ship choked in its own sails."

There's another significant anecdote I'd like to share about myself that I hadn't mentioned yet.

Rewritten:
Oh, and I forgot one important story to tell on myself.

Like... consider it for a moment. No other platform punishes its users for removing something they no longer wish to have on their page. Twitter doesn’t abruptly deactivate your account and prevent it from reaching others if you choose to delete a tweet. Instagram doesn’t hinder your reach when you delete and redo a post because you used the wrong image. So why on earth does TikTok shadowban its users just for deleting a video they no longer want on their page or because you made a spelling error in the caption or whatever the reason might be? Instead, we have to set them to private and end up with an endless collection of private videos just sitting there doing nothing. I don’t understand it. It doesn’t make any sense, does it really?

To keep my computer in top condition, I prioritize several key tasks. Regularly checking for Windows Updates ensures my system stays secure and up-to-date. I also take steps to protect my online identity by hiding my email address from public user profiles and websites. Additionally, I'm mindful of the checkboxes I select when registering on websites, being cautious not to inadvertently share my information.

Rewritten:
Security Essentials, Windows Updates, making sure my email address doesn't show on user profiles and website, and making sure I look out for those tick boxes when registering on websites, keeps my computer perfectly clean.

As Ninetails blushed and smiled at Kenji, he leaned in to kiss her. A warm sensation coursed through his body as he was with her. It caused him to shiver with each movement, starting gently and gradually growing stronger.

Rewritten:
As Ninetails shyly smiled at Kenji, he moved in to kiss her. A tingling sensation flowed through his body as he was inside her. It made him tremor with every move, starting small and beginning to intensify.

It isn't the enemy that we dread;  
It isn't the bullets that scream;  
It isn't the professional path  
Of a shell, or the blast of a mine;  
It isn't the marksmen who aim  
To cut our youthful dreams short:  
No, it isn't the firearms,  
And it isn't the Germans --  
It's the MUD,  
MUD,  
MUD.  
It isn't the chaos we fear.  
That often can be quite amusing.  
It isn't the shrapnel we see  
Intrusive when dropped by the ton;  
It isn't the impact of the bombs  
That causes us real distress:  
It's the shelling we face  
When the weather's a disgrace --  
It's the RAIN,  
RAIN,  
RAIN.  
It isn't due to a lack of courage  
That we shy away from the horrors of war.  
We don't mind the fight at all;  
In fact, that's what we are here for;  
It isn't the rum and such  
That makes us long for home once more:  
It's the fingers that freeze  
In the frigid breeze --  
It's the COLD,  
COLD,  
COLD.  
Oh, the rain, the mud, and the cold,  
The cold, the mud, and the rain;  
With temperatures at zero, it's tough for a hero  
To keep from using harsh words in vain.  
With sludgy muck up to our knees,  
With skies that are pouring a flood,  
Surely the worst of our foes  
Are the troubles and woes  
Of the RAIN,  
THE COLD,  
AND THE MUD.

Rewritten:
It isn't the foe that we fear;
It isn't the bullets that whine;
It isn't the business career
Of a shell, or the bust of a mine;
It isn't the snipers who seek
To nip our young hopes in the bud:
No, it isn't the guns,
And it isn't the Huns --
It's the MUD,
MUD,
MUD.
It isn't the melee we mind.
That often is rather good fun.
It isn't the shrapnel we find
Obtrusive when rained by the tonne;
It isn't the bounce of the bombs
That gives us a positive pain:
It's the strafing we get
When the weather is wet --
It's the RAIN,
RAIN,
RAIN.
It isn't because we lack grit
We shrink from the horrors of war.
We don't mind the battle a bit;
In fact that is what we are for;
It isn't the rum-jars and things
Make us wish we were back in the fold:
It's the fingers that freeze
In the boreal breeze --
It's the COLD,
COLD,
COLD.
Oh, the rain, the mud, and the cold,
The cold, the mud, and the rain;
With weather at zero it's hard for a hero
From language that's rude to refrain.
With porridgy muck to the knees,
With sky that's a-pouring a flood,
Sure the worst of our foes
Are the pains and the woes
Of the RAIN,
THE COLD,
AND THE MUD.

A pastor, who has a large family with his wife Amélie, adopts a young blind girl named Gertrude, whom his daughter Charlotte has taken a liking to. The pastor's love for Gertrude is reminiscent of Beethoven's Sixth Symphony, also known as the Pastoral Symphony, which he takes her to hear. However, this symphony also symbolizes the complex relationship between the pastor and Gertrude, which is a symphony of its own. Amélie, the pastor's wife, is increasingly resentful of Gertrude, as she feels the pastor is devoting more attention to the young girl than to their own children. Amélie tries to bring the pastor's feelings to the surface, but he remains oblivious to the true nature of his emotions. As a devout man, the pastor tries to shield Gertrude from the harsh realities of the world, including the concept of sin, and in doing so, he inadvertently fosters a deep affection between them. When the pastor's eldest son, Jacques, who is around the same age as Gertrude, expresses his desire to marry her, the pastor becomes jealous and refuses, despite Jacques' genuine love for her. Eventually, Gertrude undergoes surgery to restore her eyesight, and upon regaining her vision, she is disillusioned by the reality of her situation. In a desperate attempt to escape her newfound understanding, she tries to take her own life by jumping into a river, but is rescued and contracts pneumonia. As she lies on her deathbed, she reveals to the pastor that the man she had idealized in her blindness was actually Jacques, not him.

Rewritten:
It is about a pastor who adopts a young blind girl whom his daughter, Charlotte, names "Gertrude". The title refers to Beethoven's Sixth Symphony (also known as the Pastoral Symphony) which the pastor takes Gertrude to hear. It also refers to the pastor's own symphony with Gertrude. His wife, Amélie, resents Gertrude because the pastor dedicates more attention to Gertrude than to their five children. She tries to prompt him to a recognition of the true nature of his feelings for the young woman in his care. Her ability to "see" this is contrasted with the "blindness" of the pastor in this regard and the reader is invited to judge him on his intellectual dishonesty. As a religious man, the pastor takes the Bible very seriously and tries to preserve Gertrude's innocence by protecting her from the concept of sin. Because the pastor is really the main character in Gertrude's limited world, she feels herself to be in love with him and to some extent he has similar feelings toward her. When his eldest son Jacques, who is about the same age as Gertrude, asks to marry her the pastor becomes jealous and refuses despite the fact that Jacques is obviously in love with her. Gertrude eventually gets an operation to repair her eyesight and, having regained the ability to see, realizes that things are not as beautiful as the pastor made them seem. She attempts suicide by jumping into a river, but is rescued and contracts pneumonia. She realizes that the pastor is an old man, and the man she pictured when she was blind was Jacques. She tells the pastor this shortly before her death.

In recent years, deep learning has achieved significant advancements in various applications, including image detection, image segmentation, pose estimation, and speech recognition. However, this progress has also raised a pressing concern: deep networks are highly susceptible to adversarial examples. These examples are carefully crafted inputs that are designed to deceive the model into misclassifying them. In the realms of images and speech, the modifications required to create these examples are so subtle that they go unnoticed by humans, yet they have a profound impact on the model's classification.

Deep learning models have been successfully applied to malware detection, a domain where generating adversarial examples is particularly challenging. This is because even minor modifications to the binary code of a file can significantly alter its functionality and validity. To address this issue, we have developed a novel loss function specifically designed for generating adversarial examples from discrete input sets, such as executable bytes. By injecting a small sequence of bytes (payload) into malicious binaries, we can modify them to evade detection while preserving their original functionality. We have applied this approach to an end-to-end convolutional deep learning malware detection model and demonstrated a high rate of detection evasion. Furthermore, our generated payload has been shown to be robust and transferable across different locations within the same file and across different files, with an entropy level similar to that of benign data sections.

Rewritten:
In recent years, deep learning has shown performance breakthroughs in many
applications, such as image detection, image segmentation, pose estimation, and
speech recognition. However, this comes with a major concern: deep networks
have been found to be vulnerable to adversarial examples. Adversarial examples
are slightly modified inputs that are intentionally designed to cause a
misclassification by the model. In the domains of images and speech, the
modifications are so small that they are not seen or heard by humans, but
nevertheless greatly affect the classification of the model.
 Deep learning models have been successfully applied to malware detection. In
this domain, generating adversarial examples is not straightforward, as small
modifications to the bytes of the file could lead to significant changes in its
functionality and validity. We introduce a novel loss function for generating
adversarial examples specifically tailored for discrete input sets, such as
executable bytes. We modify malicious binaries so that they would be detected
as benign, while preserving their original functionality, by injecting a small
sequence of bytes (payload) in the binary file. We applied this approach to an
end-to-end convolutional deep learning malware detection model and show a high
rate of detection evasion. Moreover, we show that our generated payload is
robust enough to be transferable within different locations of the same file
and across different files, and that its entropy is low and similar to that of
benign data sections.
He let out a sound and stood frozen, his hands clenched in a gesture of regret, as he thought to himself, "I should have spoken up to her, but I didn't."

Rewritten:
He made a noise and held his hands, "I should have reprimanded her...but I didn't."

Sarah looked down at the floor, feeling the tension fill the space around them. She let out a long breath of relief when he departed, leaning back in her chair and nervously rubbing the back of her head with a light laugh. She beamed at him, springing up from her seat and walking over to embrace him. "It's alright. A bit awkward, though, but I guess it could have been much, much worse," she whispered, a gentle smile on her lips. Eventually, she let go of him, stepping back and settling into her chair again.

Rewritten:
Sarah stared at the ground, feeling the awkwardness cloud the air. She let out a deep sigh of relief when he left, leaning back against the chair and rubbing the back of her head with a nervous giggle. She smiled at him, bouncing off her chair and stepping over to him, hugging him. "It's okay. A little awkward though, but I suppose it could've been far, far more awkward." She murmured, a small smile on her face. She eventually released him from her arms, stepping back and perching on her chair once more.

’TIS Christmas, and the North wind howls; it was just yesterday, two years ago, that I stood at the bow of the Lusitania, gazing over Table Bay. A traveler circling the globe, a seeker of the sea, anticipating the moment her sails would unfurl to head back home. ’TIS Christmas, and the North wind howls; today our hearts are united, even though you are amidst the English snow while I bask in the Australian sun. You, when the Northern wind blows, stack up a grander fire, while our ladies huddle until it passes, dressed in their lawn and lace. I can almost envision you on this Christmas night, sitting just as you used to, laughter filling the air: then a sudden, quiet pause interrupts your joy, and kind eyes glisten as you happen to think of me. This morning, upon waking and realizing it was Christmas once more, I nearly imagined I could see white frost on the windowpane, hear the wheels ringing on the icy ground, and watch the drip that slowly descends in its frozen casing. I suppose you’ll be on the lake or gliding over the snow, warming your hands to get the blood flowing, snuggling your nose in the furs of your boa—while here, the thermometer reads a hundred in the shade. It doesn’t quite feel like Christmas here with this clear sky, this pure, transparent air, this sun high in the heavens; to see the rose blooming on the bush, young leaves sprouting on the trees, and hear the summer hush of the forest or the gentle buzz of bees. But cold winds don’t bring Christmas, nor do budding roses signal June, and when it’s night on your side, we’re enjoying the noon. Kind hearts create Christmas—June can bring either blue skies or clouds overhead; the only true universal spring is that which arises from love. Thus, it’s Christmas in the South just as it is on the North Sea shores, even though we suffer from summer drought while you endure winter frosts. We’ll have our roast beef here and think of you while we eat, even though the vast ocean separates us from the mother isle. Rest assured, we will think of you, we who have ventured away, and countless thoughts will travel today from south to north; wise heads will reflect on old churches where bells will ring today—the very bells, perhaps, that tolled for their fathers to rest. And now, goodnight! I shall dream that I am with you all, watching the glowing embers flicker across the panelled hall; I don’t mind whether I dream or not, for despite the ocean between us, my heart remains in the place that was my childhood home.

Rewritten:
’T IS Christmas, and the North wind blows; ’t was two years yesterday
Since from the Lusitania’s bows I looked o’er Table Bay,
A tripper round the narrow world, a pilgrim of the main,
Expecting when her sails unfurled to start for home again.
’T is Christmas, and the North wind blows; to-day our hearts are one,
Though you are ’mid the English snows and I in Austral sun;
You, when you hear the Northern blast, pile high a mightier fire,
Our ladies cower until it ’s past in lawn and lace attire.
I fancy I can picture you upon this Christmas night,
Just sitting as you used to do, the laughter at its height:
And then a sudden, silent pause intruding on your glee,
And kind eyes glistening because you chanced to think of me.
This morning when I woke and knew ’t was Christmas come again,
I almost fancied I could view white rime upon the pane,
And hear the ringing of the wheels upon the frosty ground,
And see the drip that downward steals in icy casket bound.
I daresay you ’ll be on the lake, or sliding on the snow,
And breathing on your hands to make the circulation flow,
Nestling your nose among the furs of which your boa ’s made,—
The Fahrenheit here registers a hundred in the shade.
It is not quite a Christmas here with this unclouded sky,
This pure transparent atmosphere, this sun midheaven-high;
To see the rose upon the bush, young leaves upon the trees,
And hear the forest’s summer hush or the low hum of bees.
But cold winds bring not Christmastide, nor budding roses June,
And when it ’s night upon your side we ’re basking in the noon.
Kind hearts make Christmas—June can bring blue sky or clouds above;
The only universal spring is that which comes of love.
And so it ’s Christmas in the South as on the North-Sea coasts,
Though we are starved with summer-drouth and you with winter frosts.
And we shall have our roast beef here, and think of you the while,
Though all the watery hemisphere cuts off the mother isle.
Feel sure that we shall think of you, we who have wandered forth,
And many a million thoughts will go to-day from south to north;
Old heads will muse on churches old, where bells will ring to-day—
The very bells, perchance, which tolled their fathers to the clay.
And now, good-night! and I shall dream that I am with you all,
Watching the ruddy embers gleam athwart the panelled hall;
Nor care I if I dream or not, though severed by the foam,
My heart is always in the spot which was my childhood’s home.
Thank you once more, Patrick and Kurt.

Rewritten:
Thanks again Patrick and Kurt.

From: no.address@enron.com
Subject: Enron Federal Credit Union's IRA Options

Body: 

Choosing the right Individual Retirement Account (IRA) can be a crucial decision, especially when planning for significant life milestones such as buying a new home, funding education, or securing your retirement. Enron Federal Credit Union offers a range of IRAs tailored to meet your unique needs, including Traditional, Roth, and Education IRAs.

The credit union provides several IRA options with competitive interest rates:

- A 12-month term IRA certificate with an Annual Percentage Yield (APY) of 2.75%
- A 24-month term IRA certificate with an APY of 3.25%
- A 36-month term IRA certificate with an APY of 3.75%
- A standard IRA savings account with an APY of 1.75%

You can open an IRA savings account with a minimum deposit of $25, or opt for a term IRA certificate with a minimum deposit of $500. For more information or to set up an IRA, please visit the Enron Federal Credit Union website at www.enronfcu.com or call 713.853.6902.

1 - 2 red peppers  
800 grams pumpkin or butternut, diced  
4 cloves garlic, whole and in skins  
oil for drizzling  
1 onion, chopped  
2 cloves garlic, chopped  
oil for frying  
4 cups warm stock  
6 dried apricots, finely chopped  
1 teaspoon chili oil or 1 chili finely chopped  
salt and black pepper to taste  

Preheat the oven grill. Place the peppers on a baking tray and position them under the grill. Allow the skin to blacken (rotate the peppers 90 degrees every 4 minutes or so). Remove the peppers and put them in a plastic bag to sweat for about 20 minutes. Peel off the charred skin and discard the stem and seeds, then set aside. While the peppers are sweating, lower the oven temperature to 200 degrees C. Place the pumpkin/butternut and garlic on a roasting tray and drizzle with some oil. Roast until the pumpkin is tender and the edges begin to caramelize, approximately 30 - 40 minutes. Sweat the onions and garlic in a splash of oil and fry over medium heat until softened. Add the pumpkin/butternut and sweat for an additional 5 minutes.  

Pour in the stock and let it simmer for about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and puree the soup. Add more stock if needed. In a food processor, squeeze the roasted garlic from the skins. Add the peppers, apricot, and chili oil or fresh chili. Blitz for a few seconds at a time until the mixture remains chunky. Serve the soup topped with a dollop of the salsa.

Rewritten:
1 - 2 rеd рерреrs
800 grаms рumрkіn оr buttеrnut, сubеd
4 сlоvеs gаrlіс, whоlе аnd іn skіns
оіl fоr drіzzlіng
1 оnіоn, сhорреd
2 сlоvеs gаrlіс, сhорреd
оіl fоr frуіng
4 сuрs wаrm stосk
6 drіеd арrісоts, fіnеlу сhорреd
1 tеаsрооn сhіllі оіl оr 1 сhіllі fіnеlу сhорреd
sаlt аnd blасk рерреr tо sеаsоn
Ρrеhеаt thе оvеn grіll. Рlасе thе рерреrs оn а bаkіng trау аnd рlасе undеr thе grіll. Аllоw thе skіn tо blасkеn (turn thе рерреrs 90 dеgrееs еvеrу 4 mіnutеs оr sо). Rеmоvе thе рерреrs аnd рlасе іn а рlаstіс bаg tо swеаt fоr аbоut 20 mіnutеs. Ρееl оff thе blасkеnеd skіn аnd rеmоvе thе stеm аnd аll sееds аnd sеt аsіdе. Whіlе thе рерреrs аrе swеаtіng, rеduсе thе оvеn tеmр tо 200 dеgrееs С Рlасе thе рumрkіn/buttеrnut аnd gаrlіс оn а rоаstіng trау аnd drіzzlе wіth sоmе оіl. Rоаst untіl thе рumрkіn іs сооkеd аnd thе еdgеs аrе stаrtіng tо саrаmеlіsе. Аbоut 30 - 40 mіnutеs. Swеаt thе оnіоns аnd gаrlіс іn а sрlаsh оf оіl аnd frу оvеr а mеdіum hеаt untіl sоftеnеd. Αdd thе рumрkіn/buttеrnut аnd swеаt fоr а furthеr 5 mіnutеs.
Аdd thе stосk аnd lеt іt sіmmеr fоr аbоut 10 mіnutеs. Sеаsоn wіth sаlt аnd рерреr. Rеmоvе frоm thе hеаt аnd рurее thе sоuр. Αdd sоmе mоrе stосk іf rеquіrеd. Ιn а fооd рrосеssоr, squееzе thе rоаstеd gаrlіс frоm thе skіns. Αdd thе рерреrs, арrісоt аnd сhіllі оіl оr frеsh сhіllі. Βlіtz fоr а fеw sесоnds аt а tіmе untіl thе mіхturе іs stіll сhunkу. Sеrvе thе sоuр wіth а dоllор оf thе sаlsа.

***Mау соntаіn Sроіlеrs***

I felt ashamed as an American watching this film. Just the thought of it being viewed abroad was unsettling. It's astonishing how one submarine can endure 40 depth charges while another might be incapacitated by just two. Additionally, I think it would be nearly impossible for Americans to commandeer a German sub and vice versa.

However, the most frustrating aspect of this movie is its pretentious rewriting of history. It was the British who first captured the enigma machine, NOT the Americans. We have no right to claim credit for the achievements of other nations. Hollywood simply displays a historical ignorance. Beyond that, it remains an utterly terrible, terrible film. No one with even a modicum of intelligence would find this rubbish entertaining.

Rewritten: ***Μау соntаіn Sроіlеrs***

Ι wаs еmbаrrаssеd аs аn Αmеrісаn sееіng thіs fіlm. Just knоwіng thаt іt wоuld bе sееn оvеr sеаs. Ιt's аmаzіng hоw а submаrіnе саn wіthstаnd 40 dерth сhаrgеs whіlе аnоthеr соuld bе рut оut bу twо. Αnd І bеlіеvе іt wоuld аlsо bе а vіrtuаl іmроssіbіlіtу fоr Аmеrісаns tо соmmаndееr а Gеrmаn sub аnd vісе vеrsа.

Вut thе wоrst thіng аbоut thіs mоvіе іs іts аrrоgаnt rеwrіtіng оf hіstоrу. Ιt wаs thе Βrіtіsh whо fіrst сарturеd thе еnіgmа mасhіnе ΝΟΤ thе Αmеrісаns. Wе hаvе nо rіght tо tаkе сrеdіt fоr оthеr nаtіоns ассоmрlіshmеnts. Ноllуwооd sіmрlу hаs а hіstоrісаl іgnоrаnсе. Βut bеуоnd thаt іt іs stіll just аn аwful, аwful mоvіе. Νо оnе wіth hаlf а brаіn wоuld bе еntеrtаіnеd bу thіs gаrbаgе.

Spafford is a U.S.-based jam band that fuses various musical styles such as rock, funk, jazz, reggae, ska, and electro-pop. The band was established by Brian Moss (guitar/vocals) and Jordan Fairless (bass/vocals) in Prescott, Arizona, on New Year's Eve in 2009. Andrew “Red” Johnson (keys/vocals) joined Moss and Fairless after they met at an open mic night. Shortly thereafter, Nick Tkachyk (drums/percussion/vocals) became a member, solidifying Spafford's lineup. The group independently releases its music, which includes studio albums, improvisational sessions, and soundboard recordings from their live performances. 

Spafford's musical style reflects the diverse backgrounds and influences of its various songwriters and musicians. The band employs an improvisational approach to transition within and between songs during their live performances, which frequently feature a variety of covers. Spafford tours throughout the United States, with each concert showcasing a unique setlist and interpretation of their original music. The band also offers live streams and recordings of their performances on their website.

Rewritten:
Spafford is an American jam band that blends multiple genres of music including rock, funk, jazz, reggae, ska, and electro-pop. Members Brian Moss (guitar/vocals) and Jordan Fairless (bass/vocals) formed Spafford in Prescott, Arizona on New Year's Eve in 2009. Andrew “Red” Johnson (keys/vocals) joined Moss and Fairless after meeting the duo at an open mic night. Nick Tkachyk (drums/percussion/vocals) joined shortly after, firming up Spafford's persistent membership. The group self-releases its recordings, including studio albums, improvisational sessions, and soundboard releases of their live shows. Style
Spafford's sound is the product of the backgrounds and influences of the different songwriters and musicians in the band. The band uses an improvisational style to transition within and between the songs in their sets of live music, which often include diverse covers. Spafford tours across the U.S., and each of their shows features a different setlist and approach to the songs in their catalogue of original music. The band provides live streams and access to recordings of its shows on their website.

Academy Award-nominated actor Liam Neeson recently hosted a dinner party in New York to raise awareness and funds for Belfast's Lyric Theatre. The Ballymena-born actor expressed his concern about the theatre's current state, describing it as being in a "very dilapidated condition." Lyric Theatre chairman David Johnston stated that rebuilding the theatre, which is estimated to cost £8 million, is the only viable solution.

Neeson, who has appeared in films such as Schindler's List, Michael Collins, and Star Wars: The Phantom Menace, explained that the idea behind the dinner party was to gather a group of "healthy, wealthy Irish Americans" in one room and ask for their support in fundraising efforts. The Lyric Theatre, which has been in operation for 50 years, has played a significant role in Northern Ireland's cultural and social life.

Neeson, who has a strong connection to Northern Ireland, particularly the Glens of Antrim, where his spirit belongs, spoke fondly of the theatre's impact on his life and career. He credited the theatre's founder, Mary O'Malley, with giving him his start in the profession. Neeson recalled the theatre's heyday in the 1970s, when it was a beacon of hope and light in a troubled Belfast, hosting productions from Shakespeare to Yeats to O'Casey.

The Lyric Theatre has a long history, dating back to 1968, and has launched the careers of notable actors such as Adrian Dunbar and Stephen Rea, as well as playwrights like Martin Lynch and Gary Mitchell. Speaking to the BBC Northern Ireland before the event at New York's SoHo House, Neeson expressed his admiration for Ian Paisley, the DUP leader and preacher, whom he would love to portray on the big screen. Neeson described Paisley as a "very dynamic, extraordinary figure" and recalled listening to his sermons on Friday nights in Ballymena.

Rewritten:
Ноllуwооd fіlm stаr Lіаm Νееsоn hаs hеld а dіnnеr раrtу іn Νеw Yоrk tо рrоmоtе Βеlfаst's Lуrіс Τhеаtrе.
Τhе Βаllуmеnа-bоrn асtоr sаіd thаt thе thеаtrе оn Rіdgеwау Strееt wаs іn а "vеrу dіlаріdаtеd соndіtіоn". Lуrіс сhаіrmаn Dаvіd Jоhnstоn hаs sаіd thаt rеbuіldіng thе thеаtrе, аt а соst оf £8m іs thе оnlу аnswеr. Мr Νееsоn sаіd thаt thе іdеа wаs tо gеt а bunсh оf "hеаlthу, wеаlthу Іrіsh Аmеrісаns" іn оnе rооm аnd аsk thеm tо hеlр wіth fundrаіsіng.
Τhе Οsсаr-nоmіnаtеd асtоr, whоsе fіlms іnсludе Sсhіndlеr's Lіst, Місhаеl Соllіns аnd Stаr Wаrs: Τhе Ρhаntоm Μеnасе, sаіd: "Τhе Lуrіс іs tоо іmроrtаnt tо thе сulturаl аnd sосіаl lіfе оf Νоrthеrn Іrеlаnd fоr thіs buіldіng tо сrumblе аnd fаll араrt. "Ιt gаvе mе а stаrt рrоfеssіоnаllу. Μаrу Ο'Μаllеу, thе fоundеr оf thе thеаtrе, gаvе mе mу futurе. "Ιn thоsе dауs, іn thе mіd-70s, whеn Ι wаs thеrе, wе wеrе dоіng а рlау еvеrу fоur wееks. "Βеlfаst wаs nоt а рrеttу tоwn tо bе lіvіng іn. "Τhеrе wаs sеrіоus trоublе, аs уоu knоw, but thіs thеаtrе wаs lіkе а Веlіshа bеасоn оf lіght аnd hоре sіх nіghts а wееk, dоіng еvеrуthіng frоm Shаkеsреаrе tо Yеаts tо О'Саsеу wіth а grоuр оf асtоrs аnd асtrеssеs thаt аffесtеd mе vеrу dеерlу аnd stіll dо." Τhе Lуrіс bеgаn 50 уеаrs аgо but thе dооrs ореnеd аt іts рrеsеnt sіtе оn thе Strаnmіllіs еmbаnkmеnt оvеrlооkіng thе Rіvеr Lаgаn іn 1968.
Аs wеll аs Lіаm Νееsоn, іt аlsо lаunсhеd thе саrееrs оf Αdrіаn Dunbаr аnd Stерhеn Rеа аnd рlауwrіghts suсh аs Μаrtіn Lуnсh аnd Gаrу Міtсhеll. Sреаkіng tо ВΒС Νоrthеrn Іrеlаnd bеfоrе thе еvеnt аt Νеw Yоrk's SоΗо Ноusе, Мr Νееsоn sаіd thаt hіs sріrіt bеlоngеd tо thе Glеns оf Аntrіm. Αnd hе sаіd thаt thеrе wаs оnе fіgurе frоm hіs сhіldhооd thаt hе wоuld lоvе tо роrtrау оn thе bіg sсrееn - Ιаn Ρаіslеу. Не sаіd thаt thе DUР lеаdеr аnd рrеасhеr wаs а "vеrу dуnаmіс, ехtrаоrdіnаrу fіgurе". Νееsоn usеd tо lіstеn tо hіs sеrmоns оn а Frіdау nіght іn Βаllуmеnа. Ηе sаіd: "Whаt аn оrаtоr. Не wаs frоm thаt оld sсhооl оf bіblе-thumріng rіghtеоusnеss. Вut іt wаs sо drаmаtіс. І fоund hіm vеrу роwеrful. "Ι'd lоvе tо gеt а сhаnсе tо рlау hіm sоmе tіmе."

311's third independent release, 'Unity', marked a significant milestone for the band in 1991. It was their first CD release on their own record label, What Have You Records, and also came out on cassette. Some consider 'Unity' to be the band's second album, assuming 'Dammit!' as their debut. Unfortunately, this album is no longer in print and has become extremely rare due to the limited production run of 1,000 CDs and 500 cassettes.

1. "Slinky" (written by N. Hexum) - 5:17
2. "Feels So Good" (co-written by N. Hexum, C. Sexton, and D. Martinez) - 3:08
3. "Do You Right" (co-written by C. Sexton and N. Hexum) - 4:27
4. "!@#$ the &*?=!" (co-written by N. Hexum, C. Sexton, T. Mahoney, A. Wills, and D. Martinez) - 2:54 (listed as "F B" in the liner notes)

10. "Right Now" (co-written by N. Hexum, C. Sexton, and C. Grubb) - 4:13
11. "C.U.T.M." (co-written by N. Hexum and A. Wills) - 3:37 (an abbreviation for "Cosmic Utopian Thriving Mission" as listed in the liner notes)

I've been wondering if you ever thought about me like you said you would. It's been a long time since we last spoke, and we've lost all contact since then. However, I've been searching for you, and I'm left with no way of knowing how you feel about me, especially since you promised to remember me. We were young back then, and I'm still young now, but I'm also confused about it all. Should I be giving up on someone this early in my life? Should someone as young as 16 be this down on someone? Honestly, who knows, and who cares? I finally found a way to reach out to you, but I have no idea what you'll say or how you'll react to hearing my name and knowing that I'm thinking of you. Did you forget about me, or did you keep that promise you made to me the last day we spent together? I may never find out, but I'm going to try. I won't give up on you until I'm given a direct reason to stop. That probably isn't a good thing, but I'll do it anyway.

I think the movie's advertisements are misleading. I almost didn't attend a free screening at a movie theater because the trailers and commercials made it seem like a mindless, action-packed film. However, the movie has more depth than what the ads suggest. While it does feature shirtless actors engaging in intense fight scenes and attractive actresses wearing bikinis, the film's underlying message and plot are worth exploring.

At its core, the movie is about taking responsibility for one's actions, managing emotions, and making wise decisions. It's a story that delves into the motivations behind the characters' actions, rather than just focusing on the physical aspects of the plot.

Yes, the movie is geared towards a teenage audience, with characters from wealthy backgrounds and a setting that includes expensive cars and large mansions. However, these elements are merely the backdrop for the story. The real focus is on the characters' personal growth and the choices they make. It's not a shallow action film or a series of gratuitous fight scenes.

While the movie may not be the best of the year, it's definitely not as bad as people expect. If you're looking for a rental or a movie to watch in theaters, it's worth considering. I believe the negative reception is largely due to the misleading advertising, which tries to sell the movie as a generic "fight film."

Rewritten: The advertisements for this movie do it serious injustice. I was standing in the lobby of a movie theater at a free showing, and almost didn't walk in, because the trailers and ads had me convinced it was a complete waste of time. The advertisements portray the film as being merely a vehicle for shirtless boys to beat on each other and hot girls to wear bikinis. While there is no shortage of either, the movie has a strong underlying theme and a decent plot.

At the thematic level, the movie is about accepting responsibility for your actions, controlling your emotions, and making good choices. It's as much about motivations as macho.

Yes, it is a teen-targeted movie. You've got rich kids running around in massive mansions driving expensive cars, but that's just the setting. You've got people beating the crap out of each other, but that's just a plot device. The heart of the movie is about personal growth and making choices. It's not an empty action flick or a taped brawl.

It's not the best film of the year, and it may well wind up as a late night cable movie in a few months, but it's nowhere near as bad as people expect. It's definitely worth the price of a rental, and worth the $10 to see it in theaters, if you've got no other plans. I blame the negativity largely on the advertising, which tries to sell it as "just another fight movie".

We propose adapting segmentation networks with a constrained formulation, which embeds domain-invariant prior knowledge about the segmentation regions. This knowledge can take the form of simple anatomical information, such as structure size or shape, estimated from source samples or known prior information. Our method imposes domain-invariant inequality constraints on the network outputs of unlabeled target samples. It implicitly matches prediction statistics between target and source domains with permitted uncertainty of prior knowledge. We address our constrained problem with a differentiable penalty, fully suited for standard stochastic gradient descent approaches, removing the need for computationally expensive Lagrangian optimization with dual projects. Unlike current two-step adversarial training, our formulation is based on a single loss in a single network, which simplifies adaptation by avoiding extra adversarial steps, while improving convergence and quality of training.

The comparison of our approach with state-of-the-art adversarial methods reveals substantially better performance on the challenging task of adapting spine segmentation across different MRI modalities. Our results also show robustness to impression of size priors, approaching the accuracy of a fully supervised model trained directly in a target domain. Our method can be readily used for various constraints and segmentation problems.

Unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) for cross-modality medical image segmentation has demonstrated significant advancements through domain-invariant feature learning or image appearance translation. Adapted feature learning typically struggles to identify domain shifts at the pixel level and fails to yield satisfactory results in dense semantic segmentation tasks. Image appearance translation, such as CycleGAN, effectively transforms images into various styles with appealing results; however, maintaining semantic consistency is challenging, leading to subpar cross-modality segmentation outcomes. In this paper, we introduce intra- and cross-modality semantic consistency (ICMSC) for UDA, with our primary insight being that the segmentation of synthesized images in different styles should remain consistent. Specifically, our model comprises an image translation module and a domain-specific segmentation module. The image translation module is a standard CycleGAN, while the segmentation module includes two domain-specific segmentation networks. The intra-modality semantic consistency (IMSC) compels the reconstructed image after a cycle to be segmented in the same manner as the original input image, whereas the cross-modality semantic consistency (CMSC) encourages the synthesized images post-translation to be segmented exactly as they were before translation. Comprehensive experimental results on cross-modality hip joint bone segmentation demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method, achieving an average DICE of 81.61% on the acetabulum and 88.16% on the proximal femur, outperforming other state-of-the-art methods. It is important to note that without UDA, a model trained on CT for hip joint bone segmentation is non-transferable to MRI and has nearly zero-DICE segmentation.

The Relationship Development Intervention (RDI) is a specialized therapy program designed for individuals with autism spectrum disorders (ASD). This program is built on the idea that developing dynamic intelligence is crucial for autistic individuals to lead fulfilling lives. At its core, RDI focuses on helping autistic individuals form genuine emotional connections by gradually introducing them to these experiences in a structured manner. The primary goal of RDI is to equip individuals with the motivation and skills necessary to engage in meaningful social interactions, addressing common social interaction deficits associated with autism. RDI emphasizes the development of essential skills, such as referencing, emotion sharing, coregulation, and experience sharing, which typically emerge during early childhood and adulthood. This family-centered program involves trained professionals who work with parents to modify their communication and interaction styles. The process begins with the child's education, followed by an assessment of both the parent and the child-parent interaction. Consultants then provide parents with tailored strategies to foster a "guided participation" partnership between parents and child, encouraging the child to become a "cognitive apprentice" once again. Once this partnership is established, parents can focus on implementing developmentally staged strategies aimed at restoring optimal neural connectivity through a series of "innovations" and "elaborations" to support the child's neural remediation goals.

Rewritten:
Relationship Technology Assistance (RDI) is a trademarked proprietary therapy program for autism spectrum disorders (ASD), based on the notion that the growth of dynamic intelligence is the key to maintaining the quality of life for autistic individuals. The program's core principle is that autistic individuals can engage in authentic emotional relationships if they are exposed to them in a gradual, systematic manner. The aim of therapy is to continually build up the motivation and techniques for effectively engaging in social interactions, to correct deficits in this area that are thought to be common to all autistic individuals. RDI relies on developing the building blocks of cultural connection—such as referencing, emotion sharing, coregulation, and experience sharing—that typically develop in adulthood and early childhood. RDI is a family-based program, where trained professionals help parents to alter their communication and interaction styles. There is a period of child education, followed by an evaluation of both the parent and the child-parent interaction. After that consultants support the mother through a set of specific strategies to develop a "guided participation" partnership between parents and child that will encourage the infant to once again become a "cognitive apprenticeship" to the children. Once the cognitive apprentice is in place, the mother can move on to appropriate neural remediation goals for the infant. These are developmentally staged strategies aimed to restore optimal neural connectivity through a series of "innovations" and "elaborations".

Date: Fri, 11 Aug 2000 02:21:00 -0700 (PDT)  
From: gavin.dillingham@enron.com  
To: filuntz@aol.com  
Subject: California Power Situation  
Body:  
Enclosed are several articles that provide additional insights and details regarding the California power crisis, along with testimony presented to the Senate Energy, Utilities and Communications Committee by the CEO of CAL-ISO regarding the power challenges.  
Testimony before the Senate Energy, Utilities & Communications Committee and the Assembly Utilities & Commerce Committee  
By Terry M. Winter, President and CEO  
California Independent System Operator  
August 10, 2000  
A piece from Natural Gas Intelligence dated August 10th discusses the defensive stance taken by the California Independent System Operator (Cal-ISO) in response to the claims made in Governor Davis' emergency electricity report regarding the newly deregulated market.  
Another article from Natural Gas Intelligence covers the California Independent System Operator (Cal-ISO) Board's decision on July 31st to raise the price cap to $250. It outlines the advantages and disadvantages of this price cap, along with other potential solutions for the power crisis. Additionally, the article includes remarks from California Senator Steve Peace, who describes the market as "dysfunctional" and advocates for its restructuring.

Bellow's novel, initially conceived as a short story, delves into the complex dynamics of art and power in a materialistic America. This exploration is deeply rooted in the author's own friendship with poet Delmore Schwartz, who is portrayed through the character of Von Humboldt Fleisher. Fleisher's aspirations to elevate American society through art are contrasted with the commercial success of his protégé, Charlie Citrine, who is loosely based on Bellow himself. Citrine's career flourishes, thanks in part to a Broadway play and a film adaptation of a character inspired by Humboldt. However, his success is also influenced by the advice of Rinaldo Cantabile, a wannabe gangster who prioritizes financial gain over artistic integrity, a philosophy that starkly contrasts with the values imparted by Fleisher.

Rewritten:
The novel, which Bellow initially intended to be a short story, is a roman à clef about Bellow's friendship with the poet Delmore Schwartz. It explores the changing relationship of art and power in a materialist America. This theme is addressed through the contrasting careers of two writers, Von Humboldt Fleisher (to some degree a version of Schwartz) and his protégé Charlie Citrine (to some degree a version of Bellow himself). Fleisher yearns to lift American society up through art but dies a failure. In contrast, Charlie Citrine makes quite a lot of money through his writing, especially from a Broadway play and a movie about a character named Von Trenck - a character modeled after Humboldt. Another notable character in the book is Rinaldo Cantabile, a wannabe Chicago gangster, who tries to bully Citrine into being friends and whose career advice to Citrine, focused solely on commercial interests, is the opposite of the advice Citrine was once given by his old mentor, Humboldt Fleisher, who valued artistic integrity above all other concerns.

Julie Krone is recognized as the greatest female horse racing jockey in history. By the age of 25, she had made history as the first woman to secure a riding title at a major racetrack, the first female to win five races in a single day at a New York venue, and one of only three jockeys to achieve six victories on one race card. In 1993, she became the inaugural female winner of a Triple Crown race, guiding the 14-to-1 long shot Colonial Affair to triumph in the Belmont Stakes—"demonstrating the patience, intelligence, and tactical skill that have established her as one of the nation's top competitors," noted William Nack of Sports Illustrated. The Boys Club chronicles Julie's challenges during her tomboy upbringing in rural Michigan, her early struggles with substance use, her confrontations with fellow jockeys and the media, and her ascent in the competitive world of jockeying, including the devastating racetrack accident in 1993 that severely injured her leg and chest, as well as her relentless determination to return to the sport—all part of her fierce battle to succeed as a female jockey in the male-dominated arena of horse racing. Despite facing numerous debilitating falls and obstacles, by the time she retired in 1999, Julie had achieved 3,545 race wins and amassed over $81 million in earnings.

Rewritten:
Julie Krone is the world's greatest ever female horse racing jockey. By age 25, Julie was the first woman ever to win a riding title at a major track, the first woman ever to win five races in one day at a New York track, and one of three jockeys ever to win six races on one card.http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&friendID=415718571 In 1993, she became the first female winner of a Triple Crown race, riding 14-to-1 long-shot Colonial Affair to victory in the Belmont Stakes—"showing the patience, intelligence and tactical savvy that have made her one of the nation's leading performers," wrote William Nack of Sports Illustrated.http://vault.sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1138678/index.htmhttp://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9F0CEEDB113DF935A35755C0A965958260 The Boys Club follows Julie's struggles in her tomboy childhood in rural Michigan and her early-career drug use, her battles with fellow jockeys and the media and her climb up the jockey success ladder, the horrific 1993 racetrack accident that crushed her leg and chest, and her painful determination to make a comeback - all part of her hard-hitting fight to become a female jockey in the male-dominated world of horse racing.http://www.amazon.com/Riding-My-Life-Julie-Krone/dp/0316504777 Despite a series of debilitating falls and challenges, by the time Julie retired in 1999, she had won 3,545 races and more than $81 million in purse earnings.http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2000/08/07/sports/main222526.shtml
